analyzed: ji ltar dran pa rnam par bshad //

analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As for “thus have I heard,” and so on,

analyzed: bdag gis thos pa ni bdag gis 'di skad thos pa ste /
translated: “I have heard” means “I have heard thus.”

original: dkyil 'khor chen po 'dus pa'i dus su bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad pa phyag na rdo rjes thos pa la bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor chen po 'dus pa'i dus su bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad pa phyag na rdo rjes thos pa la bya'o //
translated: It refers to what Vajrapāṇi heard the Blessed One explain at the time of the assembly of the great maṇḍala.

original: dus ji tsam zhe na //
analyzed: dus ji tsam zhe na //
translated: How long does it last?

original: dus gcig tu ste /
analyzed: dus gcig tu ste /
translated: It lasts for a moment.

original: dus zhes bya ba ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dus te /
analyzed: dus zhes bya ba ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dus te /
translated: The moment is an inconceivable moment.

original: gang gi dus na bdag gis yid bsam pa gzhan du yengs par ma gyur bar so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi dus na bdag gis yid bsam pa gzhan du yengs par ma gyur bar so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it lasts as long as the mind is not distracted to another object.

original: dus zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba na rnam par gsum yin te bde ba dus dang / sdug bsngal gyis dus dang / bsam du med pa'i dus so //
analyzed: dus zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba na rnam par gsum yin te bde ba dus dang / sdug bsngal gyis dus dang / bsam du med pa'i dus so //
translated: The moment is threefold in the lifecycle: the moment of pleasure, the moment of pain, and the moment of neither.

original: de lus rab tu sdug bsngal bar mngon du gyur pa'i gnas skabs na gang cung zhig thos shing go ba de phyis ji bzhin pa dang de dran par 'gyur na ma yin pa de kho na ste yid sdug bsngal bar mngon du gyur pa'i phyi na'o //
analyzed: de lus rab tu sdug bsngal bar mngon du gyur pa'i gnas skabs na gang cung zhig thos shing go ba de phyis ji bzhin pa dang de dran par 'gyur na ma yin pa de kho na ste yid sdug bsngal bar mngon du gyur pa'i phyi na'o //
translated: When the body is in a state of manifest pain, whatever is heard and understood is not remembered later on as it was.

original: yid shin tu bde ba tshogs pa mngon du gyur pa'i gnas @150b skabs de'i tshe yang pa gzhan dag ji ltar dran par gyur pa yin te ma yin no //
analyzed: yid shin tu bde ba tshogs pa mngon du gyur pa'i gnas @150b skabs de'i tshe yang pa gzhan dag ji ltar dran par gyur pa yin te ma yin no //
translated: When the mind is in a state of manifest pleasure, it does not remember other things as it was.

original: de'i phyir de dag gnyis po'i gnas skabs dang / gang rnam par bral ba'i skad cig ma de ma thag pa'i gzhan pa de nyid la ji lta ba'i rtogs pa'i dran pa skye'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag gnyis po'i gnas skabs dang / gang rnam par bral ba'i skad cig ma de ma thag pa'i gzhan pa de nyid la ji lta ba'i rtogs pa'i dran pa skye'o //
translated: Therefore, the moment that is free from those two states, that very moment, the memory of the realization of the way things are arises.

original: de nyid dus gcig ces pa la bsam pa gnyis po dag med pa'i dus te /
analyzed: de nyid dus gcig ces pa la bsam pa gnyis po dag med pa'i dus te /
translated: That very moment is the time of the absence of the two thoughts.

original: don gyi dngos po thams cad du 'gro ba'i sems dang / rnam par bral ba'i sdud pa po bdag gis bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa gang yin pa de'i rang bzhin 'di skad du bdag smra'o zhes sdud par byed pa'i dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: don gyi dngos po thams cad du 'gro ba'i sems dang / rnam par bral ba'i sdud pa po bdag gis bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa gang yin pa de'i rang bzhin 'di skad du bdag smra'o zhes sdud par byed pa'i dgongs pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that the compiler thinks, I, the compiler, will speak of the nature of what the Bhagavān said in this way, free from the mind that goes to all things and free from the two thoughts.

original: 'o na sems bsam pa thams cad dang rnam par bral ba'i dus gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: 'o na sems bsam pa thams cad dang rnam par bral ba'i dus gang zhig ce na /
translated: Well then, what is the time when the mind is free from all thoughts?

original: thos pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid yang dag par rig par gyur pa de ma 'ongs pa'i dus na dran pa skye ba'i gnas skabs su ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: thos pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid yang dag par rig par gyur pa de ma 'ongs pa'i dus na dran pa skye ba'i gnas skabs su ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: When the characteristics of hearing and so on become perfect knowledge, how will that become the basis for the arising of memory in the future?

original: ji srid du dran pa zhes bya ba ni bsam pa'i chos yin pas bsam pa med pa'i dran pa skye bar srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ji srid du dran pa zhes bya ba ni bsam pa'i chos yin pas bsam pa med pa'i dran pa skye bar srid pa ma yin no //
translated: As long as there is what is called “memory,” it is a mental phenomenon, and it is impossible for memory to arise without thought.

original: de'i phyir na dus gcig na zhes pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dus su ji ltar 'thad ce na /🔽c'di la brjod par bya ste bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i las gzung bar bya bas dus gang zhig tu nges par rab tu gnas pa'i dngos po la yid 'du byed pa las ma gtogs pa'i gzhan tshig dang don rnams la bsam
analyzed: de'i phyir na dus gcig na zhes pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dus su ji ltar 'thad ce na / c'di la brjod par bya ste bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i las gzung bar bya bas dus gang zhig tu nges par rab tu gnas pa'i dngos po la yid 'du byed pa las ma gtogs pa'i gzhan tshig dang don rnams la bsam
translated: Therefore, how can it be tenable to say that “at one time” means an inconceivable time?

original: pa med pa yin no //🔽de ltar dngos po'i don rnams nges pa gang yin pa la yid nan tan du gyur pa gang na /
analyzed: pa med pa yin no // de ltar dngos po'i don rnams nges pa gang yin pa la yid nan tan du gyur pa gang na /
translated: This should be explained: “Inconceivable” means that, apart from the mental activity of the mind that is fixed on a thing that is ascertained at a certain time, there is no other thought of words and their referents in the domain of worldly activity.🔽When the mind is intent on the ascertained referent of a thing,

original: dngos po'i don mang po rnams su gang gang gi tshe yid der gnas par gyur pa de'i tshe dngos po gcig pur ji ltar gyur pa'i yang dag par rig cing dran pa skye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po'i don mang po rnams su gang gang gi tshe yid der gnas par gyur pa de'i tshe dngos po gcig pur ji ltar gyur pa'i yang dag par rig cing dran pa skye ba ma yin no //
translated: at that time, how can there be the arising of the correct cognition and memory of that very thing, when the mind is elsewhere?

original: 'di dag bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag bshad pa yin no //
translated: These are the explanations.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa ni de dag dang lhan cig sdud pa po bdag gis mngon sum du thos pa de brjod par byas na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa ni de dag dang lhan cig sdud pa po bdag gis mngon sum du thos pa de brjod par byas na /
translated: All the Tathagatas and so forth. Having expressed that which was directly heard by the compiler together with them,

original: de dag dang lhan cig pa'i dus su ci yang rung ba 'ga' zhig brjod pa na 'jig rten pa rnams bden pa dang yid ches pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag dang lhan cig pa'i dus su ci yang rung ba 'ga' zhig brjod pa na 'jig rten pa rnams bden pa dang yid ches pa yin no //
translated: when something is said at the time together with them, the worldly ones are true and trustworthy.

original: des na de'i 'khor na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad bzhugs pa dang de bzhin du m'a ma k'i la sogs pa'i rdo rje rnal 'byor ma rnams kyang bzhugs shing de bzhin du 'phags pa kun dga' bo la sogs pa de dag dkyil 'khor na bzhugs pa yin
analyzed: des na de'i 'khor na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad bzhugs pa dang de bzhin du m'a ma k'i la sogs pa'i rdo rje rnal 'byor ma rnams kyang bzhugs shing de bzhin du 'phags pa kun dga' bo la sogs pa de dag dkyil 'khor na bzhugs pa yin
translated: Therefore, in his retinue, all the Tathagatas reside, and likewise, the Vajrayoginis such as Mamaki and so forth also reside, and likewise, the noble Ananda and so forth reside in the mandala.

original: no // de la 'phags pa zhes bya ba sdig pa las 'phags pas na 'phags pa ste /
analyzed: no // de la 'phags pa zhes bya ba sdig pa las 'phags pas na 'phags pa ste /
translated: There, the so-called noble means that which is superior to evil, therefore it is noble.

original: sdig pa mi dge ba rnams tshar bcad do zhes pa ji srid pa'o //
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba rnams tshar bcad do zhes pa ji srid pa'o //
translated: It is said, evil non-virtues are destroyed, for as long as it is so.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' 'jig rten dbang phyug la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor bye ba phrag brgyad cu dang thabs cig tu bzhugs pa na /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' 'jig rten dbang phyug la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor bye ba phrag brgyad cu dang thabs cig tu bzhugs pa na /
translated: In the same way, the Bodhisattva Lord of the World, together with an entourage of eight hundred million Bodhisattvas,

original: de la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis chos kyi de kho na nyid ces bya ba 'di skad du bshad pa de bdag gi sems rtse gcig pas rtogs par byas pa de dag nyid bdag gis brjod par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis chos kyi de kho na nyid ces bya ba 'di skad du bshad pa de bdag gi sems rtse gcig pas rtogs par byas pa de dag nyid bdag gis brjod par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: [thought:] “I will express those very things that the Buddha, the Blessed One, has explained as the reality of phenomena, having realized them with my one-pointed mind.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni byang chub la gang gi sems sems dpa' de gang yin pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'o zhes bya'o //🔽de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gzhan yang chos kyi de kho na nyid dus ji tsam zhig tu bka' stsal ba de brjod pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni byang chub la gang gi sems sems dpa' de gang yin pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'o zhes bya'o // de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gzhan yang chos kyi de kho na nyid dus ji tsam zhig tu bka' stsal ba de brjod pa /
translated: “Bodhisattva” means one whose mind is courageous with regard to enlightenment. He who is such is called a Bodhisattva.🔽Then the Blessed One further declared the reality of phenomena for as long as it is time.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Then, he said, “Then, the Blessed One further declared the reality of phenomena for as long as it is time.”

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni de ma thag par ro //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni de ma thag par ro //
translated: “Then” means immediately.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni 'bras bu'i rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni 'bras bu'i rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'o //
translated: The Blessed One is the Great Fruition Vajradhara.

original: rdo rje'i go 'phang chen pos shes par bya ba ni rol rtsed mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje'i go 'phang chen pos shes par bya ba ni rol rtsed mdzad pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the great vajra stage is the performance of the play.

original: bshad pas zhes bya ba ni de lta bur ro //
analyzed: bshad pas zhes bya ba ni de lta bur ro //
translated: By the explanation means in that way.

original: gang lta bur zhe na /
analyzed: gang lta bur zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: btsun mo'i bha gar yongs su zhu bar gyur to zhes bya ba'i @151b don 'di'o //
analyzed: btsun mo'i bha gar yongs su zhu bar gyur to zhes bya ba'i @151b don 'di'o //
translated: Completely melted into the bhaga of the queen is the meaning of this.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang / gsung dang / thugs rdo rje btsun mo'i bha gar mchog tu bde ba'i go 'phang la gnas pas na bcom ldan 'das der bzhugs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang / gsung dang / thugs rdo rje btsun mo'i bha gar mchog tu bde ba'i go 'phang la gnas pas na bcom ldan 'das der bzhugs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The Blessed One is said to dwell there because of abiding in the supreme bliss stage in the bhaga of the queen of the vajra body, speech, and mind of all the tathagatas.

original: bha ga la zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i bag chags thams cad yongs su 'joms pa'i gnas yin pas na'o //
analyzed: bha ga la zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i bag chags thams cad yongs su 'joms pa'i gnas yin pas na'o //
translated: Bhaga is so called because it is the abode of the complete destruction of all the habitual tendencies of afflictions.

original: mchog tu dga' ba'i ro khong du chud par byed pa'i phyir na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams nyid btsun mo'i rang bzhin du gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: mchog tu dga' ba'i ro khong du chud par byed pa'i phyir na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams nyid btsun mo'i rang bzhin du gnas pa yin no //
translated: Because of the experience of the taste of supreme joy, the tathagatas themselves abide in the nature of the queen.

original: yul gyi bag chags kyis sems can rnams kyi sems yongs su nyon mongs par gnas pa dag rjes su gzung ba'i don du /
analyzed: yul gyi bag chags kyis sems can rnams kyi sems yongs su nyon mongs par gnas pa dag rjes su gzung ba'i don du /
translated: For the sake of those sentient beings whose minds are thoroughly afflicted by the latent tendencies of objects,

original: gsang sngags kyi tshul 'di dag bcom ldan 'das kyis khyad par du yang bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gsang sngags kyi tshul 'di dag bcom ldan 'das kyis khyad par du yang bstan pa yin no //
translated: the Bhagavān taught these methods of mantra in particular.

original: de'i phyir na btsun mo'i bha ga'i ngo bor rnam par 'phrul par mdzad pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir na btsun mo'i bha ga'i ngo bor rnam par 'phrul par mdzad pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the emanation in the nature of the bhaga of the queen

original: 'dod chags chen po'i rjes su zhugs pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: 'dod chags chen po'i rjes su zhugs pa nyid kyis /
translated: is taught to be supreme, since it is engaged in great passion.

original: yul la chags pas bsreg pa'i sems can de rnams yang dag par gdon par bya ba'i phyir 'di nyid mchog tu bstan to zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yul la chags pas bsreg pa'i sems can de rnams yang dag par gdon par bya ba'i phyir 'di nyid mchog tu bstan to zhes bya'o //
translated: In order to perfectly liberate those sentient beings whose minds are burned by attachment to objects, this [method] is taught to be supreme.

original: de'i phyir na yul de rnams kyis mchog gi de kho na nyid kyi ye shes bskyed pa la /
analyzed: de'i phyir na yul de rnams kyis mchog gi de kho na nyid kyi ye shes bskyed pa la /
translated: Therefore, in order to generate the wisdom of supreme reality through those objects,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis 'jigs par mi bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis 'jigs par mi bya ste /
translated: the bodhisattvas should not be afraid.

original: de rnams la mos pa dang bral ba ni /
analyzed: de rnams la mos pa dang bral ba ni /
translated: Those who lack devotion to them

original: dge ba ma yin pa'i phyir dang / de rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin mchog tu rnam par dag pa nyid kyi phyir na'o //🔽de'i phyir na gang gi yul rnams rang bzhin nyid kyis rjes su 'brel ba'i sems can rnams la de nyid kyi chos ston par /
analyzed: dge ba ma yin pa'i phyir dang / de rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin mchog tu rnam par dag pa nyid kyi phyir na'o // de'i phyir na gang gi yul rnams rang bzhin nyid kyis rjes su 'brel ba'i sems can rnams la de nyid kyi chos ston par /
translated: because they are not virtuous, and because they are the nature of the Tathāgata, which is supremely pure.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyang thugs rje chen po rab tu 'jug go //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyang thugs rje chen po rab tu 'jug go //
translated: Therefore, the Lord also engages in great compassion for those sentient beings whose objects are naturally connected, in order to teach them the Dharma.

original: yang na yul rnams nyid ni 'khor ba'i rgyu nyid yin no //
analyzed: yang na yul rnams nyid ni 'khor ba'i rgyu nyid yin no //
translated: Or, the objects themselves are the cause of saṃsāra.

original: de'i phyir na /
analyzed: de'i phyir na /
translated: Therefore,

original: 'di rnams kyi de kho na nyid rang bzhin gyi ro yongs su shes na yang de yod pa'i shes pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi de kho na nyid rang bzhin gyi ro yongs su shes na yang de yod pa'i shes pa'i phyir na /
translated: if one understands the reality, the natural taste, of these, then because of the knowledge of their existence,

original: de mya ngan las 'das pa'i yang rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de mya ngan las 'das pa'i yang rgyu yin no //
translated: that is also the cause of nirvāṇa.

original: de'i phyir na yang /
analyzed: de'i phyir na yang /
translated: Therefore,

original: de rnams rang bzhin ji lta bar nyams su myong bar byas na zhes so //
analyzed: de rnams rang bzhin ji lta bar nyams su myong bar byas na zhes so //
translated: if one experiences them as they are naturally,

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: as it is said:

original: srid pa nyid ni yongs shes na //
analyzed: srid pa nyid ni yongs shes na //
translated: When existence itself is fully understood,

original: mya ngan las 'das zhes byar brjod //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das zhes byar brjod //
translated: it is called nirvāṇa.

original: ces so // gang dang gang nyid bcings par byung ba /🔽de dang de yang bde @152a * //
analyzed: ces so // gang dang gang nyid bcings par byung ba / de dang de yang bde @152a * //
translated: Whatever is bound,

original: ba chen por 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: ba chen por 'byung ba ste /
translated: that is also released in great bliss.

original: dper na me yis tshig pa la me la bsros pa nyid sman gyi mchog yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //🔽de bzhin du yul rnams la brten pas tshig pa'i sems can 'di rnams kyang yul rnams la /
analyzed: dper na me yis tshig pa la me la bsros pa nyid sman gyi mchog yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no // de bzhin du yul rnams la brten pas tshig pa'i sems can 'di rnams kyang yul rnams la /
translated: For example, for one who is burned by fire, the supreme medicine is to be heated by fire, not anything else.

original: ro myong ba bor nas byang chub chen po la rab tu gnas par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ro myong ba bor nas byang chub chen po la rab tu gnas par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, these sentient beings who are burned by the objects are not able to stand in great enlightenment, having abandoned the experience of the objects.

original: de nyid kyis na btsun mo'i bha ga la mchog tu mya ngan las 'das par gyur /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na btsun mo'i bha ga la mchog tu mya ngan las 'das par gyur /
translated: Therefore, in the bhaga of the queen, he became supremely liberated.

original: bcom ldan 'das chos ston par mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das chos ston par mdzad pa yin no //
translated: The Blessed One is teaching the Dharma.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gtso bo la zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad pas bcom ldan 'das la blta ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gtso bo la zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad pas bcom ldan 'das la blta ba ste /
translated: The chief of all tathāgatas is the Blessed One, who is seen by all tathāgatas.

original: gang zhig bdun pa yin pa de bzhin na yang drug pa nyid du blta ba yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig bdun pa yin pa de bzhin na yang drug pa nyid du blta ba yin te /
translated: Although he is the seventh, he is seen as the sixth.

original: drug pa dang bdun pa dag pa ni gnas skabs 'gar dbyer med pa yin pas so //
analyzed: drug pa dang bdun pa dag pa ni gnas skabs 'gar dbyer med pa yin pas so //
translated: The sixth and seventh are pure, because they are inseparable at some time.

original: yongs su zhu ba'i rgyu gsungs pa /
analyzed: yongs su zhu ba'i rgyu gsungs pa /
translated: The cause of melting is stated:

original: rdo rje dang padma zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rdo rje dang padma zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: By the union of the vajra and lotus, etc.

original: de yang 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal las yongs su bsgral ba'i phyir mchog gi sngags la sogs pa'i de kho na nyid bstan pas sems can 'di dag myur du dngos grub thob par nus par 'gyur bar bya ba la'o //
analyzed: de yang 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal las yongs su bsgral ba'i phyir mchog gi sngags la sogs pa'i de kho na nyid bstan pas sems can 'di dag myur du dngos grub thob par nus par 'gyur bar bya ba la'o //
translated: Moreover, in order to liberate them from the sufferings of cyclic existence, by teaching the reality of the supreme mantras, etc., she acts so that these sentient beings may quickly be able to attain accomplishments.

original: 'o na ni bcom ldan 'das yum de nyid rang gis ci de lta bu'i de kho na nyid mi mkhyen nam /
analyzed: 'o na ni bcom ldan 'das yum de nyid rang gis ci de lta bu'i de kho na nyid mi mkhyen nam /
translated: Well then, does the Blessed One's Mother herself not know such reality?

original: gang gis ni bcom ldan 'das la zhu ba mdzad pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis ni bcom ldan 'das la zhu ba mdzad pa yin zhe na /
translated: By whom was the request made to the Blessed One?

original: de la brjod par bya ba ste /
analyzed: de la brjod par bya ba ste /
translated: There it is to be stated:

original: gang gi yang dam pa'i don ni mkhyen pa ma yin pa de lta mod kyang sems can rnams rjes su gzung bar bya ba'i rgyus de lta bu'i de kho na nyid bstan pa'i don gyi spyod pa mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi yang dam pa'i don ni mkhyen pa ma yin pa de lta mod kyang sems can rnams rjes su gzung bar bya ba'i rgyus de lta bu'i de kho na nyid bstan pa'i don gyi spyod pa mdzad pa yin no //
translated: Although he does not know the ultimate truth, still he acts for the sake of teaching that suchness for the purpose of caring for sentient beings.

original: de lta bu'i dam tshig gi dam pa rnams kyis rang bzhin dang lhan cig tu ston par 'gyur ba ni shin tu'ang tshad ma yin par 'gro'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i dam tshig gi dam pa rnams kyis rang bzhin dang lhan cig tu ston par 'gyur ba ni shin tu'ang tshad ma yin par 'gro'o //
translated: The teaching of such a supreme commitment together with the natural one becomes extremely valid.

original: de lta bu'i dam tshig nyid ni bcom ldan 'das kyis rtogs pa'i dgongs par dbu'i thod pa las sngags 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu'i dam tshig nyid ni bcom ldan 'das kyis rtogs pa'i dgongs par dbu'i thod pa las sngags 'byung ba yin no //
translated: That such a commitment itself is the mantra that arises from the skull-cup of the realized intention of the Blessed One.

original: des de las gzigs pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngags bstan te /
analyzed: des de las gzigs pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngags bstan te /
translated: By him, just by seeing that, and so on, the mantra is taught.

original: aom buddhe / siddhe zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste ;
analyzed: aom buddhe / siddhe zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste ;
translated: Oṃ budhe, siddhe, and so on.

original: sngags de nyid kyi nus mthu skad cig tsam gyis gsal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: sngags de nyid kyi nus mthu skad cig tsam gyis gsal bar byed pa'o //
translated: The power of that very mantra makes it clear in an instant.

original: de lta bu'i sngags kyi mchog song bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de lta bur byung ba tsam gyis sngags kyi mchog de nyid kyis sa'i 'og rim pa bdun na gnas pa'i klu thams cad phye mar byas nas slar 'ongs @154b te ;
analyzed: de lta bu'i sngags kyi mchog song bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de lta bur byung ba tsam gyis sngags kyi mchog de nyid kyis sa'i 'og rim pa bdun na gnas pa'i klu thams cad phye mar byas nas slar 'ongs @154b te ;
translated: The supreme mantra, having gone like that, etc. means that by merely arising like that, that very supreme mantra, having reduced to powder all the nagas dwelling in the seven underworlds, returns.

original: bcom ldan 'das ri mo can gyi sde'i zhal nas zhugs nas padma'i nang nas byung ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ri mo can gyi sde'i zhal nas zhugs nas padma'i nang nas byung ste /
translated: Having entered the mouth of the Blessed One, it emerges from the lotus.

original: slar yang bcom ldan 'das nyid kyi dbu'i thod par zhugs so //
analyzed: slar yang bcom ldan 'das nyid kyi dbu'i thod par zhugs so //
translated: Again, it enters the skull of the Blessed One himself.

original: de lta bu'i rim pa 'di ni rnal 'byor bas kyang sngags 'don pa'i dus su yang bya ba yin par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rim pa 'di ni rnal 'byor bas kyang sngags 'don pa'i dus su yang bya ba yin par blta bar bya ste /
translated: This process is to be seen by the yogi as well, even when reciting the mantra.

original: rang gi kho nas zhugs nas rdo rje'i lam nas 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i sngags bzlas pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi kho nas zhugs nas rdo rje'i lam nas 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i sngags bzlas pa'o //
translated: Having entered his own, it emerges from the vajra path, and the mantra is recited.

original: 'o na yang 'di lta bu zhig yin /
analyzed: 'o na yang 'di lta bu zhig yin /
translated: But it is like this:

original: gang yang sngags 'di ri mo can gyi sde'i zhal nas zhugs nas padmar byung ste zhes bya ba ji srid pa 'di lta bur sus yang dag par rig par ji ltar 'gyur ba dang / gang zhig zhal du zhugs nas rna ba'i nang du nges par 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir sngags de srid pa ni sgra'i bdag nyid yin la /
analyzed: gang yang sngags 'di ri mo can gyi sde'i zhal nas zhugs nas padmar byung ste zhes bya ba ji srid pa 'di lta bur sus yang dag par rig par ji ltar 'gyur ba dang / gang zhig zhal du zhugs nas rna ba'i nang du nges par 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir sngags de srid pa ni sgra'i bdag nyid yin la /
translated: And, that which entered the mouth and definitely went into the ear, since that mantra is sound,🔽that sound is to be heard by the ear.

original: sgra de srid pa ni rna bas mnyan par bya ba yin pa gang gi zhugs pa de rna ba gsal na ni dbang po gzhan gyis 'dzin pas thams cad kyi bdag nyid khar rab tu zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra de srid pa ni rna bas mnyan par bya ba yin pa gang gi zhugs pa de rna ba gsal na ni dbang po gzhan gyis 'dzin pas thams cad kyi bdag nyid khar rab tu zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If that which entered the mouth were to be heard by the ear, since it would be apprehended by another sense faculty, it would not be the case that it has the nature of all.

original: de'i tshe ji ltar na bdag gi khar rab tu zhugs pa de rna ba gsal na ni dbang po gzhan gyis 'dzin pas dbang po'i gzung ba'i dbye ba med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe ji ltar na bdag gi khar rab tu zhugs pa de rna ba gsal na ni dbang po gzhan gyis 'dzin pas dbang po'i gzung ba'i dbye ba med par 'gyur te /
translated: At that time, how could that which entered the mouth be heard by the ear? It would not be the case that it is apprehended by a different sense faculty, since it would not be the case that it is a different type of sense object.

original: gang gis na rna bas gzung bar bya ba'i sngags ro ldan gyi dbang pos gzung bar bya bar 'gyur la ;
analyzed: gang gis na rna bas gzung bar bya ba'i sngags ro ldan gyi dbang pos gzung bar bya bar 'gyur la ;
translated: How could a mantra that is to be apprehended by the ear be apprehended by a sense faculty that has a tongue?

original: de lta na ni sngon po la sogs pa yang rna bas gzung bar bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: de lta na ni sngon po la sogs pa yang rna bas gzung bar bya bar gnas so //
translated: If that were so, then blue and so on would also be apprehended by the ear.

original: de lta na ni dbang po'i dbye ba'i tshogs don med par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: de lta na ni dbang po'i dbye ba'i tshogs don med par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: If that were so, then the collection of sense faculties would be meaningless,

original: dbang po gcig gis sna tshogs pa kun rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po gcig gis sna tshogs pa kun rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all variety would be realized by a single sense faculty.

original: 'di mi rtogs pa de lta na ni de bzhin du rtogs pa min no zhes bya bar rigs kyi thams cad rna bar rtogs na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di mi rtogs pa de lta na ni de bzhin du rtogs pa min no zhes bya bar rigs kyi thams cad rna bar rtogs na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is not realized in that way, then it is reasonable to say that it is not realized in that way, but if all is realized by the ear, then there would be an absurd consequence.

original: des na rna bas rtogs par byas te phyis khar zhugs nas padma'i nang du byung ngo zhes bya ba la ni sun dbyung bar bya ba med do zhes pa de dag kyang bzang po ma yin la /
analyzed: des na rna bas rtogs par byas te phyis khar zhugs nas padma'i nang du byung ngo zhes bya ba la ni sun dbyung bar bya ba med do zhes pa de dag kyang bzang po ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, there is no fault in saying that it is realized by the ear and later enters the mouth and emerges inside the lotus.

original: gang gi tshe de srid pa'i sngags kyi bdag nyid rna ba'i spyod yul du gyur pa de'i tshe sngags de nyid mchog tu rtogs par rigs na ji ltar na khyad par du zhugs te zhes bya ba la sogs par rtogs pa de'i tshe mi rigs te rna ba
analyzed: gang gi tshe de srid pa'i sngags kyi bdag nyid rna ba'i spyod yul du gyur pa de'i tshe sngags de nyid mchog tu rtogs par rigs na ji ltar na khyad par du zhugs te zhes bya ba la sogs par rtogs pa de'i tshe mi rigs te rna ba
translated: When that mantra is the nature of the world and becomes the object of the ear, at that time it is logical to realize that mantra itself as supreme.🔽But when it is realized as “How does it enter into distinctions?” and so on, at that time it is illogical.🔽

original: tsam la mngon du gnas pa'i phyir ro //🔽gang gi tshe kha la sogs par zhugs pa @155a * //
analyzed: tsam la mngon du gnas pa'i phyir ro // gang gi tshe kha la sogs par zhugs pa @155a * //
translated: When the mantra’s nature exists as the object of the ear, it is reasonable to realize that it is supreme. But when it enters the body, it is unreasonable to realize it in that way, because it abides in the ear alone.

original: yin pa de'i tshe rna bas gzung bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir de ji ltar de bzhin par rtogs /
analyzed: yin pa de'i tshe rna bas gzung bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir de ji ltar de bzhin par rtogs /
translated: When it enters the mouth, it is not an object of the ear, so how can it be realized as it is?

original: de nas yang rna bas bzung bar bya ba ma yin na'ang yid kyis sngags kyi bdag nyid rang rig pa yin par gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: de nas yang rna bas bzung bar bya ba ma yin na'ang yid kyis sngags kyi bdag nyid rang rig pa yin par gyur pa yin te /
translated: If it is not an object of the ear, it is the nature of the mantra that is self-aware through the mind.

original: yid kyi spyod yul du ma gyur pa 'ga' yang ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer na 'di yang ma grub ste /
analyzed: yid kyi spyod yul du ma gyur pa 'ga' yang ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer na 'di yang ma grub ste /
translated: Because there is nothing that is not an object of the mind.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid ni yid kyis yang dag par rig par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid ni yid kyis yang dag par rig par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the nature of pleasure, pain, etc. is perceived by the mental faculty.

original: sngags 'di dag ni rna ba'i dbang pos gzung bar bya ba yin na yid kyis ji ltar rtogs par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: sngags 'di dag ni rna ba'i dbang pos gzung bar bya ba yin na yid kyis ji ltar rtogs par byed pa yin te /
translated: If these mantras are to be apprehended by the ear faculty, how can they be perceived by the mental faculty?

original: de rtogs na ni sngon po la sogs pa yang dbang po gzhan gyis gzung bar bya ba yin par 'gyur bas de rna ba'i gzung bar bya bar gyang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rtogs na ni sngon po la sogs pa yang dbang po gzhan gyis gzung bar bya ba yin par 'gyur bas de rna ba'i gzung bar bya bar gyang 'gyur ro //
translated: If they are perceived by the mental faculty, then blue, etc. would also be apprehended by another faculty, and thus they would be apprehended by the ear.

original: de ltar gyur pa yin na 'on pa la sogs pas kyang sgra la sogs pa rnams 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa yin na 'on pa la sogs pas kyang sgra la sogs pa rnams 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If that were so, then it would follow that the deaf, etc. would also apprehend sound, etc.

original: de dag la yang yid yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la yang yid yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have a mental faculty.

original: de ltar yin na ni 'on pa dang long ba la sogs pa mi srid par gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yin na ni 'on pa dang long ba la sogs pa mi srid par gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then the deaf, the blind, etc. would not exist.

original: de lta na ni 'ga' zhig tu yang sngags rnams rna bas rab tu rtogs shing khong du chud pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'ga' zhig tu yang sngags rnams rna bas rab tu rtogs shing khong du chud pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, in no case are mantras perceived and understood by the ear.

original: yid kyis gzung ba'i phyir na'o //
analyzed: yid kyis gzung ba'i phyir na'o //
translated: because the mind apprehends it.

original: yang na yul gyi dngos po gcig la dbang po gnyis kyis 'dzin par 'gyur ba mi srid de /
analyzed: yang na yul gyi dngos po gcig la dbang po gnyis kyis 'dzin par 'gyur ba mi srid de /
translated: Or else, it is impossible for two sense faculties to apprehend one object-field,

original: sngon po la sogs pa yang rna ba'i gzung bar bya bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa yang rna ba'i gzung bar bya bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that blue, etc. would be apprehended by the ear.

original: de ltar yin na yang skyon du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar yin na yang skyon du mi 'gyur te /
translated: Even if that were the case, there would be no error,

original: dbang po gnyis kyis yul gyi dngos po gcig la 'dzin par yang 'ga' zhig tu mi 'gal te /
analyzed: dbang po gnyis kyis yul gyi dngos po gcig la 'dzin par yang 'ga' zhig tu mi 'gal te /
translated: because it is not contradictory for two sense faculties to apprehend one object-field in some cases.

original: ji ltar me'i dngos po la mig gi dbang pos 'dzin pa dang / lus kyi reg par byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: ji ltar me'i dngos po la mig gi dbang pos 'dzin pa dang / lus kyi reg par byed pa nyid do //
translated: For example, the eye sense faculty apprehends the entity fire, and the body sense faculty touches it.

original: de lta bu yang yid dga' bar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta bu yang yid dga' bar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: But that is not pleasing to the mind.

original: de la 'dir me'i sreg par byed pa'i rdul phra rab kyang gzhan yin la blta bar bya ba'i rdul phra rab kyang gzhan yin pa de ltar gnas so //
analyzed: de la 'dir me'i sreg par byed pa'i rdul phra rab kyang gzhan yin la blta bar bya ba'i rdul phra rab kyang gzhan yin pa de ltar gnas so //
translated: For in that case, the particles of fire that burn are different from the particles of fire that are seen.

original: de lta bu'i me'i dngos po la 'dir blta bar bya ba dang / reg par bya ba dag gcig par spyod cing dngos po'i don gcig tu bsdus par blta ba ni 'khrul ba kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bu'i me'i dngos po la 'dir blta bar bya ba dang / reg par bya ba dag gcig par spyod cing dngos po'i don gcig tu bsdus par blta ba ni 'khrul ba kho na'o zhe na /
translated: In this way, the entity of fire is seen and touched by the same person, and the object of the entity is seen to be included in one thing.

original: de la 'dir brjod par bya ste yid kyi shes pa 'di nyid kyis sngags @155b rnams rtogs pa yin pa la ni 'dir skyen 'ga' zhig kyang yin na ma yin te /
analyzed: de la 'dir brjod par bya ste yid kyi shes pa 'di nyid kyis sngags @155b rnams rtogs pa yin pa la ni 'dir skyen 'ga' zhig kyang yin na ma yin te /
translated: Here, we say this: In this very mental consciousness, the mantras are realized. Here, no one is confused about this.

original: 'khor ba pa'i sems can thun mong ba'i yid la skyon yod pa de ltar bcom ldan 'das yul gyi thugs gang yin pas snyan gyi dngos pos gzung bar bya ba'i sngags de 'dzin par mi nus pa ma yin gyi thun mong ba rnams kyi yid gang yin pa
analyzed: 'khor ba pa'i sems can thun mong ba'i yid la skyon yod pa de ltar bcom ldan 'das yul gyi thugs gang yin pas snyan gyi dngos pos gzung bar bya ba'i sngags de 'dzin par mi nus pa ma yin gyi thun mong ba rnams kyi yid gang yin pa
translated: The mind of ordinary beings in cyclic existence has faults. In that way, the Bhagavān, whose mind is free from objects, is not unable to apprehend the mantra that is to be apprehended with the entity of the ear. The mind of ordinary beings

original: de ni dbang po'i dbye ba so so ba rnam par rtogs pa ma yin pa ltar /
analyzed: de ni dbang po'i dbye ba so so ba rnam par rtogs pa ma yin pa ltar /
translated: is not a conceptual consciousness of the individual divisions of the sense organs.

original: khyad par can rnams kyi yang de ltar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: khyad par can rnams kyi yang de ltar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not like that for those with special faculties.

original: de'i spyod yul thams cad yin pa'i phyir na'o //
analyzed: de'i spyod yul thams cad yin pa'i phyir na'o //
translated: because it is the domain of all of them.

original: yang brgal ba 'di ltar sems te rang yang dag par rig pa'i mtshan nyid las ma rtogs pa'i yid gzhan pa'i rang bzhin ni 'ga' yang ma mthong ste /
analyzed: yang brgal ba 'di ltar sems te rang yang dag par rig pa'i mtshan nyid las ma rtogs pa'i yid gzhan pa'i rang bzhin ni 'ga' yang ma mthong ste /
translated: Again, one might argue as follows: Apart from the nature of correct self-awareness, no other nature of mind is perceived.

original: de 'di ltar so so yang dag par rig pa'i bdag nyid tsam gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir na yid kyi khyad par 'ga' zhig kyang ma mthong ngo zhe na /
analyzed: de 'di ltar so so yang dag par rig pa'i bdag nyid tsam gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir na yid kyi khyad par 'ga' zhig kyang ma mthong ngo zhe na /
translated: Since it is the nature of mere self-awareness, no difference in mind is perceived.

original: de ni ma yin te 'dir skyes bu tsam du gcig kyang thams cad kha dog ser po zhes rtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te 'dir skyes bu tsam du gcig kyang thams cad kha dog ser po zhes rtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not so. Here, although all are the same in being mere persons, it is not the case that all are cognized as yellow.

original: de lta yin par gyur na ni skyes bu tsam gyis thams cad kha dog ser po grub par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin par gyur na ni skyes bu tsam gyis thams cad kha dog ser po grub par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were the case, then it would follow that all are established as yellow by mere person.

original: 'dir yang skyes bu tsam du gcig par khyad par 'ga' yang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: 'dir yang skyes bu tsam du gcig par khyad par 'ga' yang mi dmigs na /
translated: Here, although all are the same in being mere persons, no difference is observed.

original: de ltar ji ltar gzugs kyi khyad par 'grub pa 'di ltar mthong ste /
analyzed: de ltar ji ltar gzugs kyi khyad par 'grub pa 'di ltar mthong ste /
translated: In this way, the difference in form is established. This is what is seen.

original: kha dog gi yid ni bstan bcos thams cad phyin ci ma log par shes pa can yin la /
analyzed: kha dog gi yid ni bstan bcos thams cad phyin ci ma log par shes pa can yin la /
translated: The mind of color is the one who knows all treatises without error.

original: kha cig gi ni de lta ma yin pa de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs ni ji ltar de kho na nyid thams cad mkhyen pa'i rang bzhin yin pa de ji ltar na tha mal pa'i gnas skabs su ji ltar gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: kha cig gi ni de lta ma yin pa de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs ni ji ltar de kho na nyid thams cad mkhyen pa'i rang bzhin yin pa de ji ltar na tha mal pa'i gnas skabs su ji ltar gnas pa yin te /
translated: Some are not like that. In the same way, the mind of the Bhagavān is the nature of omniscience of all that is so. How is it that it abides in the ordinary state?

original: de la yang de'i yid ces bya ba'i sgra ni tshig mthun pa tsam mo //
analyzed: de la yang de'i yid ces bya ba'i sgra ni tshig mthun pa tsam mo //
translated: In that regard, the term “his mind” is merely a conventional expression.

original: gzhan yang dbang po so so'i dbye bas yul rnams la yang ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang dbang po so so'i dbye bas yul rnams la yang ste /
translated: Moreover, due to the division of the individual faculties, the objects are also so.

original: srog chags kyi dbye bas dbang po'i dbye ba gzhan gyis gzung bar bya ba gzhan pa las blta ba nyid de ji ltar gdengs ka can rnams mig gis nyan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: srog chags kyi dbye bas dbang po'i dbye ba gzhan gyis gzung bar bya ba gzhan pa las blta ba nyid de ji ltar gdengs ka can rnams mig gis nyan pa bzhin no //
translated: Due to the division of living beings, the division of the faculties is apprehended by others. Seeing is different, just as the hooded ones listen with their eyes.

original: de'i phyir na thams cad du mthun pa tsam gyis thun mong bar dmigs par mi blta ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir na thams cad du mthun pa tsam gyis thun mong bar dmigs par mi blta ste /
translated: Therefore, one should not view the common observation as merely concordant in all cases.

original: yul dang dus dang rkyen gyi bye brag gis thams cad la khyad par yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul dang dus dang rkyen gyi bye brag gis thams cad la khyad par yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is a difference in all things due to the differences of place, time, and condition.

original: 'o na yid 'di'i khyad @156a * //🔽par ci lta bu zhig na ci lha rnams kyi khyad par gyis de bzhin du 'di'i rang bzhin nyid dam /
analyzed: 'o na yid 'di'i khyad @156a * // par ci lta bu zhig na ci lha rnams kyi khyad par gyis de bzhin du 'di'i rang bzhin nyid dam /
translated: What is the difference in this mind?

original: 'on te gzhan rgyu las byung zhig gam ci zhig yin /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan rgyu las byung zhig gam ci zhig yin /
translated: Is it due to the difference in the gods, or is it due to the difference in their causes?

original: gal te gang gi tshe 'di rang bzhin nyid yin pa de srid ni yid kyi rang bzhin gyis gzugs yin pa de'i tshe ni thams cad kyi yang de bzhin du rang bzhin gyis khyad par gyi mngon du gnas pa'i phyir ni /
analyzed: gal te gang gi tshe 'di rang bzhin nyid yin pa de srid ni yid kyi rang bzhin gyis gzugs yin pa de'i tshe ni thams cad kyi yang de bzhin du rang bzhin gyis khyad par gyi mngon du gnas pa'i phyir ni /
translated: If it is due to the difference in their nature, then, if mind is by nature form, then at that time, because of the manifestation of the difference in nature of all things,

original: yid kyi rang bzhin yin pa des na de bzhin du khyad par 'ga' yang med pa yin te /
analyzed: yid kyi rang bzhin yin pa des na de bzhin du khyad par 'ga' yang med pa yin te /
translated: there is no difference in mind due to its nature.

original: srog chags thams cad kyi yang der mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: srog chags thams cad kyi yang der mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the same for all living beings.

original: de nas yang rgyu las byung ba'i khyad par yod pa de lta na yang khyad par 'ga' yang med pa yin te /
analyzed: de nas yang rgyu las byung ba'i khyad par yod pa de lta na yang khyad par 'ga' yang med pa yin te /
translated: If it is due to the difference in their causes, then, even if there is a difference in the causes, there is no difference in the result.

original: gzhan la yang rgyu dang rkyen gyi byed pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan la yang rgyu dang rkyen gyi byed pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because other people also have the activity of causes and conditions.

original: de la rgyu yod na yang rgyu'i khyad par gyi rang bzhin ni srog chags thams cad kyis ma rtogs pa des na srog chags thams cad kyi yid khyad par can du grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la rgyu yod na yang rgyu'i khyad par gyi rang bzhin ni srog chags thams cad kyis ma rtogs pa des na srog chags thams cad kyi yid khyad par can du grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Even if there is a cause, the nature of the specific cause is not understood by all living beings. Therefore, the special mind of all living beings is not established.

original: 'o na rgyu de kun la yod pa la rang gi ye shes skye ba'i sbyor ba ma rtogs pa gang la yang med par 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'o na rgyu de kun la yod pa la rang gi ye shes skye ba'i sbyor ba ma rtogs pa gang la yang med par 'gyur la /
translated: If that is so, then the cause exists for all, but the application for the arising of one’s own wisdom does not exist for anyone.

original: de ltar gyur pa yin na ni ci yod /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa yin na ni ci yod /
translated: If that is the case, what is there?

original: de'i khyad par du byed pa'i rgyu ci yis rtogs par byed /
analyzed: de'i khyad par du byed pa'i rgyu ci yis rtogs par byed /
translated: By what cause that makes it special is it understood?

original: gang gis lta ba'i khyad par de rab tu rtogs pa ni yid khyad par can du grub po zhes bya ba yang ji lta bu rang gis rang rtogs so zhes bya ba de lta bu yang med de /
analyzed: gang gis lta ba'i khyad par de rab tu rtogs pa ni yid khyad par can du grub po zhes bya ba yang ji lta bu rang gis rang rtogs so zhes bya ba de lta bu yang med de /
translated: Also, how is it that the one who fully understands that special view is established as having a special mind? It is not like that, that one understands oneself.

original: yod na ni de bzhin du gzhan rnams kyang de ltar rab tu rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod na ni de bzhin du gzhan rnams kyang de ltar rab tu rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were, then others would also fully understand it in that way.

original: gzhan man ngag brgyud cing brgyud pa gzhan las kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan man ngag brgyud cing brgyud pa gzhan las kyang ma yin te /
translated: It is not transmitted from another, nor is it transmitted from another lineage.

original: de yang ji lta ba zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji lta ba zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: rang gis rang rab tu rtogs pa ni med de yod na ni skyon brjod zin to //
analyzed: rang gis rang rab tu rtogs pa ni med de yod na ni skyon brjod zin to //
translated: Self-realization of self does not exist, for if it did, the error would have been stated.

original: de la brgyud cing brgyud pa las rtogs par 'gyur na yang thug pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la brgyud cing brgyud pa las rtogs par 'gyur na yang thug pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were realized through transmission and lineage, the error of infinite regress would occur.

original: de'i phyir na bcom ldan 'das kyis yid khyad par 'phags par grub pa ji ltar yin pa dang / rgyu gzhan gyis byed pa yid khyad par can du byas pa yin na /
analyzed: de'i phyir na bcom ldan 'das kyis yid khyad par 'phags par grub pa ji ltar yin pa dang / rgyu gzhan gyis byed pa yid khyad par can du byas pa yin na /
translated: Therefore, if the mind were established as superior by the Bhagavān, and if it were made superior by another cause,

original: yid bzhin du de thams cad du brtan pa ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yid bzhin du de thams cad du brtan pa ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: then it would not be stable in all cases, as desired.

original: rgyu las byung ba'i bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du brtan pa'i rang bzhin ma yin par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu las byung ba'i bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du brtan pa'i rang bzhin ma yin par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would not be stable by nature, like a pot produced from causes and so forth.

original: de'i phyir na yid @156b khyad par can du brtan pa ma yin te res 'ga' ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir na yid @156b khyad par can du brtan pa ma yin te res 'ga' ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the mind is not stable as superior, because it is sometimes not.

original: de'i phyir na yid khyad par can du rab tu grub pa'i dgos pa de ni 'ga' zhig tu yang grub pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir na yid khyad par can du rab tu grub pa'i dgos pa de ni 'ga' zhig tu yang grub pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the purpose of establishing a special mind is not established in any way.

original: de la brjod par bya ste yid khyad par can 'di nyid ni rang bzhin yang yin la /
analyzed: de la brjod par bya ste yid khyad par can 'di nyid ni rang bzhin yang yin la /
translated: In response to that, it is said that this very special mind is the nature

original: de bzhin du gzhan 'di rgyu yang yin pa 'di la gnod pa 'ga' yang med de /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan 'di rgyu yang yin pa 'di la gnod pa 'ga' yang med de /
translated: and, likewise, the cause. There is no fault in this at all, because the cause🔽is merely the condition that makes it manifest, and likewise, the nature of

original: rgyu ni mngon par gsal bar byed pa'i rkyen tsam yin pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin du dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid kun du snang bar gnas pa'i yid nyid yin te /
analyzed: rgyu ni mngon par gsal bar byed pa'i rkyen tsam yin pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin du dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid kun du snang bar gnas pa'i yid nyid yin te /
translated: things is the mind that appears.🔽However, since it is covered by the stains of its own traces, it appears

original: 'on kyang rang rang gi bag chags kyi dri mas g-yogs pas de bzhin par snang ba yin pas des na thams cad kyi yid don gyi dngos po thams cad rab tu gsal bar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang rang rang gi bag chags kyi dri mas g-yogs pas de bzhin par snang ba yin pas des na thams cad kyi yid don gyi dngos po thams cad rab tu gsal bar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: as if it were not. Therefore, the mind of everyone does not manifest all🔽things.

original: dper na ling tog gi skyon dang ldan pa'i skye ba can la me long shin tu gsal ba yin yang g-yogs pa ltar 'gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: dper na ling tog gi skyon dang ldan pa'i skye ba can la me long shin tu gsal ba yin yang g-yogs pa ltar 'gyur pa yin no //
translated: For example, for a person who has the fault of cataracts, even a very clear mirror will be covered.

original: des na rgyu yang de lta bu'i dngos po'i phyir na /
analyzed: des na rgyu yang de lta bu'i dngos po'i phyir na /
translated: Therefore, the cause is also like that.

original: de la sgrib pa'i skyon rnams sel bar byed pa nyid ma yin pas na /
analyzed: de la sgrib pa'i skyon rnams sel bar byed pa nyid ma yin pas na /
translated: Since it is not the case that the faults of obscuration are removed in that [mirror],

original: de khyad par can gyi rang bzhin du skye ba ma yin la /
analyzed: de khyad par can gyi rang bzhin du skye ba ma yin la /
translated: it is not born with a special nature.

original: rgyu de'i khyad par can ni glo bur ba'i dri ma'i skyon rnams sel bar byed pa'i mtshan nyid tsam yin la /
analyzed: rgyu de'i khyad par can ni glo bur ba'i dri ma'i skyon rnams sel bar byed pa'i mtshan nyid tsam yin la /
translated: That special cause is merely characterized by removing the faults of adventitious stains.

original: de yang de kun gyis khong du chud pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang de kun gyis khong du chud pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, that is not understood by everyone.

original: dper na yod pa yin yang mi mthong ba nyid ni khron pa zab mo'i nang na yod pa'i rdzas kun gyis mthong zhing rtogs pa ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na yod pa yin yang mi mthong ba nyid ni khron pa zab mo'i nang na yod pa'i rdzas kun gyis mthong zhing rtogs pa ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, even though it exists, it is not seen. The substance that exists in a deep well is not seen or realized by everyone.

original: de lta bu'i rgyu de yang bla ma brgyud cing brgyud par khong du chud par byed pa la thug pa med pa'i skyon yang 'byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rgyu de yang bla ma brgyud cing brgyud par khong du chud par byed pa la thug pa med pa'i skyon yang 'byung ba ma yin te /
translated: And there is no fault of infinite regress in the understanding of such a cause as being transmitted through a succession of gurus.

original: thug pa med pa'i dngos po de lta bu'i skyon gyis gnod pa med de 'khor ba la thog ma med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thug pa med pa'i dngos po de lta bu'i skyon gyis gnod pa med de 'khor ba la thog ma med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no fault of infinite regress in such a thing, because samsara is beginningless.

original: de lta bu'i phyir na ci yang de ltar min na kun kyang mi 'grub ste ji srid du 'bras dkar po'i myu gu 'di yang ji ltar skye bar 'gyur zhig na rang gi sa bon las so zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bu'i phyir na ci yang de ltar min na kun kyang mi 'grub ste ji srid du 'bras dkar po'i myu gu 'di yang ji ltar skye bar 'gyur zhig na rang gi sa bon las so zhe na /
translated: Therefore, if it were not so, then nothing would be established. But how could a white rice sprout arise? It arises from its own seed.

original: de'i sa bon yang ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: de'i sa bon yang ci zhig ce na /
translated: And what is its seed?

original: rang gi sa bon las so zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rang gi sa bon las so zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: It is that which arises from its own seed.

original: 'o na thams cad thug pa med par 'gyur ba ji ltar min te yin no //
analyzed: 'o na thams cad thug pa med par 'gyur ba ji ltar min te yin no //
translated: Well then, how is it that everything does not become infinite regress? It is.

original: 'o na bag chags de yang gang las skye ba zhig yin /
analyzed: 'o na bag chags de yang gang las skye ba zhig yin /
translated: Well then, from what does that latent potentiality arise?

original: gang ji @157a * //
analyzed: gang ji @157a * //
translated: What?

original: srid pa'i sems 'di thams cad du gsal ba'i rang bzhin yin na yang kun nas sgribs pa gang gis na tha mal pa'i sems can du gnas pa'i yid 'di lha'i dngos po ji bzhin pa ma yin na de la gang gi tshe ji srid du sems la sa
analyzed: srid pa'i sems 'di thams cad du gsal ba'i rang bzhin yin na yang kun nas sgribs pa gang gis na tha mal pa'i sems can du gnas pa'i yid 'di lha'i dngos po ji bzhin pa ma yin na de la gang gi tshe ji srid du sems la sa
translated: Although this mind of existence is the nature of clarity in every way, it is obscured by something, and so this mind that abides as an ordinary sentient being is not divine.

original: ma gtogs pa'i logs shig pa'i rgyu las de skye ba yin na /
analyzed: ma gtogs pa'i logs shig pa'i rgyu las de skye ba yin na /
translated: If it arises from a cause that is separate from the mind,

original: de'i tshe de sems las ma gtogs pa'i rgyu gzhan zhig las kyang rgyu gzhan zhig yod dgos pa des na chos nyid gnyis su med par mi 'grub la /
analyzed: de'i tshe de sems las ma gtogs pa'i rgyu gzhan zhig las kyang rgyu gzhan zhig yod dgos pa des na chos nyid gnyis su med par mi 'grub la /
translated: then at that time, since it would be necessary for there to be another cause that is separate from the mind, it would not be established as the nondual dharmatā.

original: des na yang bag chags de nyid sems nyid las skye ba yin na yang de'i tshe bag chags rnams 'ga' zhig tu yang gsal bar mi brel bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na yang bag chags de nyid sems nyid las skye ba yin na yang de'i tshe bag chags rnams 'ga' zhig tu yang gsal bar mi brel bar 'gyur te /
translated: Also, if those traces arise from the mind itself, then at that time, the traces would not be clarified at all,

original: sems de dus thams cad du yod pa'i phyir na'o //
analyzed: sems de dus thams cad du yod pa'i phyir na'o //
translated: because the mind exists at all times.

original: de yang ci ste zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ci ste zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mi skye mi srid pa ste byed pa nus pa can rnams yod bzhin du yang bya ba rnams skye bar 'gyur ba med na ni thams cad du bya ba dang 'bras bu kun skye ba med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi skye mi srid pa ste byed pa nus pa can rnams yod bzhin du yang bya ba rnams skye bar 'gyur ba med na ni thams cad du bya ba dang 'bras bu kun skye ba med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If, while the causes are present, the effects do not arise, it follows that all effects and activities will never arise.

original: de'i phyir na bag chags rnams dus thams cad du skye bar 'gyur ba nyid dam yang na dus thams cad du gdod nas mi skye bar gnas par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir na bag chags rnams dus thams cad du skye bar 'gyur ba nyid dam yang na dus thams cad du gdod nas mi skye bar gnas par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, habitual tendencies will either arise at all times or they will never arise.

original: de la bag chags skye ba gtan du med na ni de dus thams cad du skye ba med pa yin pas 'ga' zhig tu yang sems la dri mas ji ltar bsgos te rgod pa'i rgyu med pa des na yid khyad par can zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: de la bag chags skye ba gtan du med na ni de dus thams cad du skye ba med pa yin pas 'ga' zhig tu yang sems la dri mas ji ltar bsgos te rgod pa'i rgyu med pa des na yid khyad par can zhes bya ba dang /
translated: If habitual tendencies never arise, they will never arise at any time. How could they ever taint the mind? Since there would be no cause for agitation, there would be no such thing as a special mental consciousness.

original: khyad par can ma yin pa zhes bya ba 'ga' yang med par 'gyur ba gang gis na mya ngan las 'das pa dang / 'khor ba zhes bye ba dang / grol ba dang mi grol ba'i sems kyi gnas skabs kun la 'jug par ji ltar 'thad /
analyzed: khyad par can ma yin pa zhes bya ba 'ga' yang med par 'gyur ba gang gis na mya ngan las 'das pa dang / 'khor ba zhes bye ba dang / grol ba dang mi grol ba'i sems kyi gnas skabs kun la 'jug par ji ltar 'thad /
translated: In that case, since there would be nothing at all that is not special, how could it be tenable to posit the states of mind of cyclic existence and nirvana, of being liberated and not being liberated?

original: de nas yang bag chags dus thams cad du rgyu ba can yin na yang de'i tshe tha mal pa'i sems can dang 'di las gzhan pa'i khyad par du mi 'grub pa gang gis na bcings pa dang grol ba'i gnas skabs dang gzhag pa med par 'gyur ro zhe
analyzed: de nas yang bag chags dus thams cad du rgyu ba can yin na yang de'i tshe tha mal pa'i sems can dang 'di las gzhan pa'i khyad par du mi 'grub pa gang gis na bcings pa dang grol ba'i gnas skabs dang gzhag pa med par 'gyur ro zhe
translated: Moreover, even if habitual tendencies are present at all times, since they are not established as being different from that, how could there be a basis for positing the states of being bound and liberated?

original: na / gang yang ye shes nyid las bag chags rnams skye ba yang 'on kyang 'khor ba la 'chel te zhen par gnas pas de las byung ba tsam gyis dus thams cad du yod par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: na / gang yang ye shes nyid las bag chags rnams skye ba yang 'on kyang 'khor ba la 'chel te zhen par gnas pas de las byung ba tsam gyis dus thams cad du yod par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Although habitual tendencies arise from wisdom itself, since they are fixated on cyclic existence, they are merely what arise from that. They are not present at all times, nor are they nonexistent.

original: med par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i skyon med de /
analyzed: med par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i skyon med de /
translated: There is no fault.

original: de ji srid du 'khor @157b pa'i rjes su 'jug par gnas pa'i sems de srid nyid du ni de'i rgyun du 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ji srid du 'khor @157b pa'i rjes su 'jug par gnas pa'i sems de srid nyid du ni de'i rgyun du 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: As long as the mind remains engaged in the cycle of existence, it is the cause of the continuum of the mind.

original: de lta bu'i sems de ni 'khor ba'i ngo bor rtogs par bya bar gnas te phyin ci log gi ngo bor rab tu bsal ba'i phyir na de lta bu'i bag chags kyi bdag nyid yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu'i sems de ni 'khor ba'i ngo bor rtogs par bya bar gnas te phyin ci log gi ngo bor rab tu bsal ba'i phyir na de lta bu'i bag chags kyi bdag nyid yin no //
translated: The mind, which is of such a nature, is to be understood as the essence of the cycle of existence, because it is the basis of the erroneous inversion.

original: des na thams cad nas thams cad du yid thun mong ba'i skyon med do //
analyzed: des na thams cad nas thams cad du yid thun mong ba'i skyon med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no fault in the commonality of the mind for all.🔽Since the mind of all is engaged in the cycle of existence, it does not remain at all times in the state of nirvāṇa.

original: thams cad kyi yid 'khor ba las 'chel pas dus thams cad du gnas pa ma yin pa de srid du 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i lugs dag yod pa las kyang mod /
analyzed: thams cad kyi yid 'khor ba las 'chel pas dus thams cad du gnas pa ma yin pa de srid du 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i lugs dag yod pa las kyang mod /
translated: As long as that is so, the systems of the cycle of existence and nirvāṇa exist.

original: de mi 'dod kyang khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de mi 'dod kyang khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Even though it is not accepted, it must be accepted.

original: gzhan du na ni dus thams cad nas mya ngan las 'das pa 'ba' zhig tu gnas pa'am /
analyzed: gzhan du na ni dus thams cad nas mya ngan las 'das pa 'ba' zhig tu gnas pa'am /
translated: Otherwise, it would remain in nirvāṇa at all times,

original: yang na srid pa nyid 'ba' zhig tu gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na srid pa nyid 'ba' zhig tu gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: or it would remain in existence alone.

original: de'i phyir na 'khor ba de srid par du thams cad du yod pa nyid de de yang bag chags kyi bdag nyid can gyi sems kyi rang bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir na 'khor ba de srid par du thams cad du yod pa nyid de de yang bag chags kyi bdag nyid can gyi sems kyi rang bzhin nyid do //
translated: Therefore, samsara exists in all ways until the end of existence, and it is the nature of the mind that has the nature of traces.

original: de'i phyir na bag chags kyi bdag nyid can gyi yid 'khor ba'i rjes su mthun pa'i rang bzhin byed pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir na bag chags kyi bdag nyid can gyi yid 'khor ba'i rjes su mthun pa'i rang bzhin byed pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the mind that has the nature of traces is the nature that is consistent with samsara.

original: de ni yid de nyid kyi rnam pa'i dngos por rtogs par bya ba la /
analyzed: de ni yid de nyid kyi rnam pa'i dngos por rtogs par bya ba la /
translated: That should be understood as the entity of the aspect of that mind itself.

original: 'khor ba de yang thog ma med pa'i phyir na sngon du bsags pa'i lus kyi bag chags kyi stobs las mig 'phrul mkhan gyis sprul pa'i dngos po'i rnam pa bzhin du bag chags dang yongs su ldan pa'i yid gang gis 'dzin pa ni 'khor bar 'gyur ba yin
analyzed: 'khor ba de yang thog ma med pa'i phyir na sngon du bsags pa'i lus kyi bag chags kyi stobs las mig 'phrul mkhan gyis sprul pa'i dngos po'i rnam pa bzhin du bag chags dang yongs su ldan pa'i yid gang gis 'dzin pa ni 'khor bar 'gyur ba yin
translated: Since samsara is beginningless, the mind that possesses traces is samsara, which arises from the power of the traces of the body that were previously accumulated, like the aspect of an entity emanated by a magician.

original: la / mig 'phrul mkhan gyis sprul pa dang 'dra bar byung ba'i 'khor ba yang bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin no //
analyzed: la / mig 'phrul mkhan gyis sprul pa dang 'dra bar byung ba'i 'khor ba yang bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin no //
translated: Samsara, which arises like an emanation of a magician, is inconceivable.

original: des na 'khor bar kun du 'jug cing chags pas 'khor ba yin par khas blang ba lta los kyang med de /
analyzed: des na 'khor bar kun du 'jug cing chags pas 'khor ba yin par khas blang ba lta los kyang med de /
translated: Therefore, it is not at all accepted that cyclic existence is the engagement and attachment of the mind,

original: bag chags kyi rang bzhin can gyi yid kun du skye ba gang yin pa de nyid ni 'khor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bag chags kyi rang bzhin can gyi yid kun du skye ba gang yin pa de nyid ni 'khor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: because the arising of the mind that has the nature of latent impressions is called “cyclic existence.”

original: de'i phyir na sngon gyi las kyis bskyed pa'i stobs kyis bcings pa'i yid kyis bag chags kyi rang bzhin du 'byung ba ni 'khor ba'i mtshan nyid du 'byung ba yin no //🔽gang gi tshe 'khor ba'i gnas skabs la mchog tu mi byed na de'i tshe bag chags kyi rang bzhin 'gar yang gnas pa ma yin pas yid 'od gsal bar zhes bya ba dang / 'od gsal ma @158a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir na sngon gyi las kyis bskyed pa'i stobs kyis bcings pa'i yid kyis bag chags kyi rang bzhin du 'byung ba ni 'khor ba'i mtshan nyid du 'byung ba yin no // gang gi tshe 'khor ba'i gnas skabs la mchog tu mi byed na de'i tshe bag chags kyi rang bzhin 'gar yang gnas pa ma yin pas yid 'od gsal bar zhes bya ba dang / 'od gsal ma @158a * //
translated: Therefore, the arising of the mind that is bound by the power generated by previous karma in the nature of latent impressions is the arising of the characteristic of cyclic existence.

original: yin zhes bya ba yang med pas khyad par med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yin zhes bya ba yang med pas khyad par med par 'gyur ro //
translated: When one does not take the state of cyclic existence to be supreme, then at that time, since the nature of latent impressions does not exist anywhere, the mind is neither called “clear light” nor “not clear light,” and so there is no difference.

original: de'i phyir na mig 'phrul mkhan gyis sprul pa bzhin du 'khor ba lugs su 'byung bar khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir na mig 'phrul mkhan gyis sprul pa bzhin du 'khor ba lugs su 'byung bar khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, like the emanation of a magician, one should accept the arising of cyclic existence.

original: gzhan yang mig 'phrul mkhan gyis sprul pa mthong ba yin zhe na /🔽ji srid du dri ma med pa'i dbang po bden pa'i dngos po de srid pa de lta bu'i shes pas ni de byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang mig 'phrul mkhan gyis sprul pa mthong ba yin zhe na / ji srid du dri ma med pa'i dbang po bden pa'i dngos po de srid pa de lta bu'i shes pas ni de byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, if you say that the magician sees the emanation,🔽then the cognition of that sort does not produce it, as long as the pure sense faculty is a real thing.

original: de byed na ni dus thams cad du bden par gyur pa yang dag par shes pa skye ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de byed na ni dus thams cad du bden par gyur pa yang dag par shes pa skye ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it did produce it, then it would be impossible for a cognition of a real thing to arise at all times.

original: de'i phyir ni de dag kyang brdzun tsam du 'byung bar ci las skye bar 'gyur snyam du sems so zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir ni de dag kyang brdzun tsam du 'byung bar ci las skye bar 'gyur snyam du sems so zhe na /
translated: Therefore, how could those also arise as mere falsehoods?

original: de ni sngags dang sman gyi nus mthus dbang po'i yon tan dang bral bar byas pa las so zhe'o //🔽'o na dus thams cad du de lta min pa ci ste zhe na /
analyzed: de ni sngags dang sman gyi nus mthus dbang po'i yon tan dang bral bar byas pa las so zhe'o // 'o na dus thams cad du de lta min pa ci ste zhe na /
translated: It is from the power of the mantra and medicine that the sense faculty is deprived of its quality.🔽Well, why is it not like that at all times?

original: de bzhin du yang rab tu sbyor ba de nyid kyang dus thams cad du med pa ci ste zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang rab tu sbyor ba de nyid kyang dus thams cad du med pa ci ste zhe na /
translated: Why is it not the case that the application itself is not like that at all times?

original: de ni de'i tshe las kyi rnam par smin pa med par gyur bas de bzhin no zhe'o //
analyzed: de ni de'i tshe las kyi rnam par smin pa med par gyur bas de bzhin no zhe'o //
translated: It is just like that because at that time the ripening of karma is absent.

original: las kyi rnam par smin pa mi mthun pa de nyid kyang gang zhig las skye bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pa mi mthun pa de nyid kyang gang zhig las skye bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the cause of the maturation of karma that is not homogeneous?

original: 'khor bas bsgos pa'i yid de bzhin pa'i nus mthus sprul pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'khor bas bsgos pa'i yid de bzhin pa'i nus mthus sprul pa yin no zhe na /
translated: It is the mind that is imbued with cyclic existence.🔽Why is that mind not homogeneous in its power?

original: yid de nyid de lta bu'i mthu can du mi 'dra bar gang gi phyir skye zhe na srid pa'i ngo bo nyid du gnas pa'i sems ni nus mthu rnam pa sna tshogs pa dang ldan pa yin par rjes su rtogs so zhes smra'o //
analyzed: yid de nyid de lta bu'i mthu can du mi 'dra bar gang gi phyir skye zhe na srid pa'i ngo bo nyid du gnas pa'i sems ni nus mthu rnam pa sna tshogs pa dang ldan pa yin par rjes su rtogs so zhes smra'o //
translated: It is because the mind that is the nature of existence is understood to have various powers.🔽Thus, because it is endowed with a mind that engages in existence, the mind is unimpeded.

original: 'dis na de nyid srid pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i yid dang ldan pas yid thogs pa med pa nas las kyi srid par rab tu 'jug pa'i phyir las mi 'dra ba rnams kyis sprul pa'i dngos por gnas pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab par skye ba 'di la
analyzed: 'dis na de nyid srid pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i yid dang ldan pas yid thogs pa med pa nas las kyi srid par rab tu 'jug pa'i phyir las mi 'dra ba rnams kyis sprul pa'i dngos por gnas pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab par skye ba 'di la
translated: Since it engages in the existence of karma, the existence of the emanation that is produced by various karmas is inconceivable.

original: gnod pa 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: gnod pa 'ga' yang med do //
translated: There is no harm in this.

original: des na sems de nyid bag chags kyi sprul par skye ba la 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na sems de nyid bag chags kyi sprul par skye ba la 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, that mind itself is not produced as the emanation of traces.

original: de lta bu'i sngags kyis mthu zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de lta bu'i sngags de ji skad du brjod pa de'i mthu las nor rgyas la sogs pa'i klu chen po rnams 'ongs nas ri mo can gyi sde la bka' nod cing lha mo ji ltar bgyi
analyzed: de lta bu'i sngags kyis mthu zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de lta bu'i sngags de ji skad du brjod pa de'i mthu las nor rgyas la sogs pa'i klu chen po rnams 'ongs nas ri mo can gyi sde la bka' nod cing lha mo ji ltar bgyi
translated: The power of such a mantra, as it is expressed, is that the great nāgas such as Vāsuki come and listen to the order of the one with the painting, and the goddess says, “What should I do?”

original: zhes so // de nas ri mo can gyi sdes de dag la bka' bsgo ba sangs rgyas dang rjes su mthun par byos shig ces so //
analyzed: zhes so // de nas ri mo can gyi sdes de dag la bka' bsgo ba sangs rgyas dang rjes su mthun par byos shig ces so //
translated: Then the one with the painting gives them the order, “Be in accord with the Buddha.”

original: de ltar sngags kyi mthu gsungs @158b nas rgyud kyi don ji ltar yin pa'i glegs bam phyung ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar sngags kyi mthu gsungs @158b nas rgyud kyi don ji ltar yin pa'i glegs bam phyung ba gsungs pa /
translated: Having thus taught the power of the mantra, he teaches the emergence of the book that is the meaning of the tantra.

original: de skad thos pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de skad thos pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The mere hearing of that, etc.

original: rnal 'byor ma'i bla na med pa zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud bla na med pa ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma'i bla na med pa zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud bla na med pa ste /
translated: The unexcelled of yoginīs is the unexcelled tantra of yoginīs.

original: gang gi phyir 'di las mchog med pa de bas na rgyud 'di dang mtshungs pa med de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di las mchog med pa de bas na rgyud 'di dang mtshungs pa med de /
translated: Since there is nothing higher than this, this tantra is without equal.

original: rgyud 'di ni sangs rgyas thod pa zhes bya bar brjod de /
analyzed: rgyud 'di ni sangs rgyas thod pa zhes bya bar brjod de /
translated: This tantra is called Buddhakapāla.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi dbu'i thod pa las sngags la sogs pa rnams bton pas na de'i bdag nyid kyi rgyud la yang de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi dbu'i thod pa las sngags la sogs pa rnams bton pas na de'i bdag nyid kyi rgyud la yang de skad ces bya ste /
translated: Since the mantras and so forth were extracted from the skull on the head of the Blessed Buddha, the tantra that has that as its nature is called that.

original: sangs rgyas dbu'i thod pa las byung ba'i rgyud ni bya ba dang / byed par nye bar spyod do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dbu'i thod pa las byung ba'i rgyud ni bya ba dang / byed par nye bar spyod do //
translated: The tantra that arose from the skull on the head of the Buddha is engaged in action and agent.

original: bya ba dang byed pa de lta bu ni sangs rgyas thod pa zhes bya bar brjod do //
analyzed: bya ba dang byed pa de lta bu ni sangs rgyas thod pa zhes bya bar brjod do //
translated: Such action and agent is called Buddhakapāla.

original: yang na sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rdo rje'i rnam grangs so //
analyzed: yang na sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rdo rje'i rnam grangs so //
translated: Or, the term “Buddha” is a synonym for vajra.

original: thod pa zhes bya ba yang gru gsum gyi ngo bo la bya bas na /
analyzed: thod pa zhes bya ba yang gru gsum gyi ngo bo la bya bas na /
translated: And “kapāla” refers to the nature of a triangle.

original: shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid kyi ni sangs rgyas thod pa zhes bya bar brjod do //
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid kyi ni sangs rgyas thod pa zhes bya bar brjod do //
translated: Therefore, the one whose nature is wisdom and method is called Buddhakapāla.

original: de nyid kyis ni glegs bam la sogs pa rnams sems can rnams rjes su gzung bar bya ba'i phyir ri mo can gyi sdes phyag na rdo rje la gtad pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyis ni glegs bam la sogs pa rnams sems can rnams rjes su gzung bar bya ba'i phyir ri mo can gyi sdes phyag na rdo rje la gtad pa yin no //
translated: By that very [mantra], the one with the painting entrusted it to Vajrapāṇi for the sake of guiding sentient beings.

original: gsang ba mchog dang zhes bya ba ni rgyud las gsungs pa'i de kho na nyid gang yin pa ste de ni mchog tu gsang ba'i yang mchog tu gsang ba 'di nyid sems can thams cad kyi lus la bzhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: gsang ba mchog dang zhes bya ba ni rgyud las gsungs pa'i de kho na nyid gang yin pa ste de ni mchog tu gsang ba'i yang mchog tu gsang ba 'di nyid sems can thams cad kyi lus la bzhugs pa yin no //
translated: The supreme secret is the reality taught in the tantras, which is the supreme secret of secrets, abiding in the bodies of all sentient beings.

original: 'o na de kho na nyid kyi mchog de nyid sems can thams cad kyi yang lus la gnas pa yin na sems can thams cad kyi bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa rnams kyang gcig gi dngos por rig par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na de kho na nyid kyi mchog de nyid sems can thams cad kyi yang lus la gnas pa yin na sems can thams cad kyi bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa rnams kyang gcig gi dngos por rig par 'gyur te /
translated: If that supreme reality abides in the bodies of all sentient beings, then the happiness, suffering, etc. of all sentient beings would be known as a single entity,

original: de'i de kho na nyid de ni don dam pa'i rang bzhin gcig pa nyid kyi phyir dang / yang sems can thams cad 'khor bar bcings pa med par yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i de kho na nyid de ni don dam pa'i rang bzhin gcig pa nyid kyi phyir dang / yang sems can thams cad 'khor bar bcings pa med par yang 'gyur te /
translated: because that reality is of the nature of the ultimate, which is one. Moreover, all sentient beings would not be bound in saṃsāra,

original: thams cad kyi de kho na nyid kyi rang bzhin ni gcig pa nyid tsam gyi phyir dang / yang 'khor ba zhes bya ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya bar gzhag pa'i lugs kyang med par 'gyur na /
analyzed: thams cad kyi de kho na nyid kyi rang bzhin ni gcig pa nyid tsam gyi phyir dang / yang 'khor ba zhes bya ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya bar gzhag pa'i lugs kyang med par 'gyur na /
translated: Because the nature of reality of all things is just the same, and there would be no way to posit “saṃsāra” and “nirvāṇa.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa 'di ji ltar 'brel zhe na /🔽'di la brjod par bya ste gang thams cad kyi don dam pa de kho @159a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa 'di ji ltar 'brel zhe na / 'di la brjod par bya ste gang thams cad kyi don dam pa de kho @159a * //
translated: How is this statement of the Bhagavān to be interpreted?

original: na nyid ni rang bzhin gcig pa kho na ste /
analyzed: na nyid ni rang bzhin gcig pa kho na ste /
translated: Here we say: The ultimate reality of all things is just the same in nature.

original: de ltar na yang 'khor ba'i bag chags kyis yongs su gzung ba'i phyir dang / thog ma med pa'i dus na sems can rnams kyi blo rang dang gzhan du dmigs pas gzung ba'i phyir na de lta bu de gsal bar ma gyur to //
analyzed: de ltar na yang 'khor ba'i bag chags kyis yongs su gzung ba'i phyir dang / thog ma med pa'i dus na sems can rnams kyi blo rang dang gzhan du dmigs pas gzung ba'i phyir na de lta bu de gsal bar ma gyur to //
translated: Even so, it is not manifest because it is grasped by the imprints of saṃsāra and because the minds of sentient beings since beginningless time are grasped by the observation of self and other.

original: 'dis na ji srid du 'khor ba'i gnas skabs dag tu lta ba yod pa de srid de bzhin par gyur ba'i de kho na nyid ji ltar rtogs /
analyzed: 'dis na ji srid du 'khor ba'i gnas skabs dag tu lta ba yod pa de srid de bzhin par gyur ba'i de kho na nyid ji ltar rtogs /
