translated: As long as there is a view in the states of saṃsāra, how can suchness, which is just as it is, be realized?

original: 'dis ni 'di mi shes pa'i rgyu 'di'i phyir na bdag dang gzhan du yang dag par rig pa'i yid ni 'khor ba'i bcings pa yin pas bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa gcig gi dngos por yin par mang po'i so sor rig par 'gyur ba yin te
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di mi shes pa'i rgyu 'di'i phyir na bdag dang gzhan du yang dag par rig pa'i yid ni 'khor ba'i bcings pa yin pas bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa gcig gi dngos por yin par mang po'i so sor rig par 'gyur ba yin te
translated: This verse shows that because of this ignorance, the mind that conceives of self and other is the bondage of samsara. Therefore, the mind is the single entity that knows happiness and suffering and so on.🔽

original: / thog ma med pa'i bag chags las yongs su gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / thog ma med pa'i bag chags las yongs su gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This verse shows that because of this ignorance, the mind that knows self and other is the bondage of samsara. Therefore, the mind is the one thing that is the basis of happiness and suffering, because it is the transformation of beginningless habitual tendencies.

original: de yang dper na zla ba ni gcig nyid yin yang so so'i mig gi skyon gyis kha cig la rnam pa sna tshogs par 'gyur ba bzhin du /
analyzed: de yang dper na zla ba ni gcig nyid yin yang so so'i mig gi skyon gyis kha cig la rnam pa sna tshogs par 'gyur ba bzhin du /
translated: Moreover, just as the moon, though one, appears as various things to some due to the fault of their eyes,

original: de rnams kyi yang dag par rig pa yang dngos po sna tshogs su skye ba dang / chu steng dang ba mang na zla ba gcig po'i gzugs brnyan yang mang por dmigs par 'gyur ba de bzhin du mi shes pa yang kun du snang bar gnas pa nyid kyi phyir na rnam par bcings pa yang brdzun tsam gyis kyang sdug bsngal grub pa yin te
analyzed: de rnams kyi yang dag par rig pa yang dngos po sna tshogs su skye ba dang / chu steng dang ba mang na zla ba gcig po'i gzugs brnyan yang mang por dmigs par 'gyur ba de bzhin du mi shes pa yang kun du snang bar gnas pa nyid kyi phyir na rnam par bcings pa yang brdzun tsam gyis kyang sdug bsngal grub pa yin te
translated: Thus, even though the bondage is false, suffering is established.

original: / dper na mkha'i'o zil la thag pa la sprul gyi dngos por gzung ba des 'jigs pa las shin tu sdug bsngal ba mngon du nyams su myong ba yin yang de yang dag par ni sdug bsngal de sprul nyid kyis bskyed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: / dper na mkha'i'o zil la thag pa la sprul gyi dngos por gzung ba des 'jigs pa las shin tu sdug bsngal ba mngon du nyams su myong ba yin yang de yang dag par ni sdug bsngal de sprul nyid kyis bskyed pa ma yin no //
translated: For example, a rope is apprehended as a snake in the darkness of the sky, and one experiences the suffering of fear. However, that suffering is not produced by the snake itself.

original: de'i phyir na brdzun tsam gyis kyang sdug bsngal 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir na brdzun tsam gyis kyang sdug bsngal 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, even though it is false, suffering arises.

original: gang gi tshe yang de 'dra ba'i bag chags las skye ba'i 'khor ba bcom na ni de'i tshe 'ga' zhig tu yang 'khor bar bcings pa'i sdug bsngal 'byung bar mi 'gyur bas bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa yang med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe yang de 'dra ba'i bag chags las skye ba'i 'khor ba bcom na ni de'i tshe 'ga' zhig tu yang 'khor bar bcings pa'i sdug bsngal 'byung bar mi 'gyur bas bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa yang med par 'gyur te /
translated: When one has destroyed cyclic existence born from such latent impressions, then at that time the suffering of being bound in cyclic existence will not occur for anyone, and therefore pleasure and pain, etc. will not exist.

original: bdag dang gzhan du so sor rig pa dag de'i tshe nub par gyur ba'i phyir na'o //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan du so sor rig pa dag de'i tshe nub par gyur ba'i phyir na'o //
translated: Because the awareness of self and other will have disappeared at that time.

original: nam mkha' lding dang char 'bab pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher gsungs pas ni dngos grub gang yang rung ba de thams cad bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' lding dang char 'bab pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher gsungs pas ni dngos grub gang yang rung ba de thams cad bskyed pa'o //
translated: By the extensive statement beginning with “the garuḍa, the rain, etc.,” all of those accomplishments are generated.

original: @159b de bzhin du he ru ka'i de kho na nyid chen po de nyid 'dir bsgrub par bya bar gsungs so //
analyzed: @159b de bzhin du he ru ka'i de kho na nyid chen po de nyid 'dir bsgrub par bya bar gsungs so //
translated: In the same way, that very great reality of Heruka is said to be the object of attainment here.

original: dpa' bo chen po he ru ka //
analyzed: dpa' bo chen po he ru ka //
translated: The great hero Heruka

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so forth.

original: skyed dang gnas pa'i rgyu dang ni //
analyzed: skyed dang gnas pa'i rgyu dang ni //
translated: The cause of generation and abiding

original: zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das de nyid gcig pu ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das de nyid gcig pu ste /
translated: refers to that very Blessed One alone.

original: dper na sprul gcig kho na res 'ga' ni kyag kyog tu 'dug / res 'ga' ni drang por 'dug kyang 'di'i ngo bo nyid ni so sor dbye bas gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na sprul gcig kho na res 'ga' ni kyag kyog tu 'dug / res 'ga' ni drang por 'dug kyang 'di'i ngo bo nyid ni so sor dbye bas gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: For example, a single rope may appear in various ways: sometimes it is coiled, sometimes it is straight, but its nature is not differentiated.

original: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das 'di yang gcig nyid yin na yang 'khor ba'i gzugs sna tshogs su snang bar blta'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das 'di yang gcig nyid yin na yang 'khor ba'i gzugs sna tshogs su snang bar blta'o //
translated: In the same way, the Blessed One is one alone, but he is seen in the various forms of cyclic existence.

original: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das de nyid dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin du rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das de nyid dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin du rtogs par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the Blessed One should be understood to have the nature of both existence and nonexistence.

original: 'o na gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das de nyid dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyi ga'i rang bzhin yin na 'di ko ji ltar na de gnyis su med pa'i dngos por 'byung zhig gu ste /
analyzed: 'o na gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das de nyid dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyi ga'i rang bzhin yin na 'di ko ji ltar na de gnyis su med pa'i dngos por 'byung zhig gu ste /
translated: But if the Blessed One has the nature of both existence and nonexistence, how can he be nondual?

original: dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin yin pa nyid kyis na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dag gis skyon gyi dngos po de ltar de la gnas so zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin yin pa nyid kyis na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dag gis skyon gyi dngos po de ltar de la gnas so zhe na /
translated: Because he has the nature of all things, he is free from the faults of the grasped and the grasper.

original: 'di la gsungs pa spros med dang gos med ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di la gsungs pa spros med dang gos med ces bya ba ste /
translated: Here, it is said to be “free of elaboration” and “free of stain.”

original: don dam par ni bcom ldan 'das 'di la spros pa med pas dngos po med pa'i spros pas mi rig go //
analyzed: don dam par ni bcom ldan 'das 'di la spros pa med pas dngos po med pa'i spros pas mi rig go //
translated: In the ultimate sense, the Blessed One is free of elaboration, so he is not known through the elaboration of non-entity.

original: ci ste zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gos pa med pa'i phyir te dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin ni gos pa'o //
analyzed: gos pa med pa'i phyir te dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin ni gos pa'o //
translated: Because he is free of stain. The nature of non-entity is a stain.

original: 'dis ni gos pas 'di la gzung ba med de gnyis po rnams ni skyon dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir na'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni gos pas 'di la gzung ba med de gnyis po rnams ni skyon dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir na'o //
translated: Here, because of that stain, there is no apprehension of him, because the two are flawed.

original: ci ste de dngos po dang / dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin nyid do zhes brjod pa de ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste de dngos po dang / dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin nyid do zhes brjod pa de ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: But if it is said that he is the nature of both entity and non-entity, how is that?

original: 'di la srid par spyod pa dang / zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di la srid par spyod pa dang / zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Here, it is said, “He is the one who engages in existence.”

original: bcom ldan 'das de'i 'khor bar kun du spyod pa'i dngos po dang / dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin gyi sgo nas de skad ces bya ba brjod de /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de'i 'khor bar kun du spyod pa'i dngos po dang / dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin gyi sgo nas de skad ces bya ba brjod de /
translated: The Blessed One is said to be that way in terms of the nature of both entity and non-entity, which is his engagement in saṃsāra.

original: sems can 'khor ba la spyod par brtson pa de dag rnams rnams la ston pa mdzad pa'i dngos po yin no par dgongs so //
analyzed: sems can 'khor ba la spyod par brtson pa de dag rnams rnams la ston pa mdzad pa'i dngos po yin no par dgongs so //
translated: The Teacher has thought that this is the way to teach sentient beings who are striving to engage in cyclic existence.

original: 'o na de kho na nyid kyi ye shes de gcig pu 'khor ba'i rjes su gnas pa'i phyir na dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin don dam pa de gnyis kyi rang bzhin dang bral ba yin na 'di ji ltar rigs pa yin /
analyzed: 'o na de kho na nyid kyi ye shes de gcig pu 'khor ba'i rjes su gnas pa'i phyir na dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin don dam pa de gnyis kyi rang bzhin dang bral ba yin na 'di ji ltar rigs pa yin /
translated: If the gnosis of thatness abides in the wake of cyclic existence, it is free from the nature of both things and nonthings, the nature of the ultimate. How is this tenable?

original: ji srid du bcom ldan 'das de'i rang bzhin srid pa'i rjes su @160a * //
analyzed: ji srid du bcom ldan 'das de'i rang bzhin srid pa'i rjes su @160a * //
translated: For as long as the Bhagavān knows the nature of existence to engage in cyclic existence,

original: 'jug par rab tu shes sam /
analyzed: 'jug par rab tu shes sam /
translated: or if he does not,

original: 'on te mid na gang gi tshe mi shes na ni mi shes pa de ji srid du de'i tshe de'i rang bzhin gyi srid pa dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i 'gro ba kun gyi rang bzhin du rnam par gnas pa 'di yang ji lta bu zhig ste
analyzed: 'on te mid na gang gi tshe mi shes na ni mi shes pa de ji srid du de'i tshe de'i rang bzhin gyi srid pa dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i 'gro ba kun gyi rang bzhin du rnam par gnas pa 'di yang ji lta bu zhig ste
translated: if he does not know it, then for as long as he does not know it, how could the nature of existence, the nature of all transmigrating beings who are things and nonthings, abide in that way?

original: / gang yang shes pa de sngon po'i dngos gzhi tsam du ma skyes na ni ser po'i rang bzhin du shes pa skye ba'i rig pa med pa dang / zla ba gcig pu med na gnyis kyi gzugs su des ji ltar rig par 'gyur //
analyzed: / gang yang shes pa de sngon po'i dngos gzhi tsam du ma skyes na ni ser po'i rang bzhin du shes pa skye ba'i rig pa med pa dang / zla ba gcig pu med na gnyis kyi gzugs su des ji ltar rig par 'gyur //
translated: If, on the other hand, that consciousness did not arise as the mere basis of blue, then there would be no awareness of the arising of the consciousness that has the nature of yellow. And if there is no single moon, how could it be cognized as two?

original: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das 'di shes nas srid par 'jug na ni de'i tshe de rang rig pa'i rang bzhin gyis 'jug //
analyzed: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das 'di shes nas srid par 'jug na ni de'i tshe de rang rig pa'i rang bzhin gyis 'jug //
translated: Then, if the Lord, having cognized this, enters existence, then at that time he would enter with the nature of self-awareness.

original: de la gal te rang gi rang bzhin nyid kyis rig pas 'jug na ni srid pa 'di yang de ltar rig pas na srid pa 'di yang dngos po dang / dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin kun du so sor gsal bar ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la gal te rang gi rang bzhin nyid kyis rig pas 'jug na ni srid pa 'di yang de ltar rig pas na srid pa 'di yang dngos po dang / dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin kun du so sor gsal bar ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: If he enters with the nature of self-awareness, then since this existence is cognized in that way, how could this existence be clearly distinguished as having the nature of both entity and non-entity?

original: de'i rang bzhin la 'di dag lta bu'i rang bzhin dang bral ba'i phyir na /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin la 'di dag lta bu'i rang bzhin dang bral ba'i phyir na /
translated: Because its nature is devoid of such a nature.

original: sngon po'i rang bzhin nyid du gsal ba na ser po'i dngos por blo skye srid pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: sngon po'i rang bzhin nyid du gsal ba na ser po'i dngos por blo skye srid pa med pa nyid do //
translated: When it is clearly blue, it is impossible for the mind to arise as the entity of yellow.

original: de'i phyir na sna tshogs pa'i srid pa 'di yang ji lta ba'i rang bzhin gyis rab tu gsal bas na bcom ldan 'das 'di yang dngos po dang / dngos po med pa'i 'gro ba rkun gyi rang bzhin des rab tu gsal bar mi 'gyur te de'i rang bzhin gnyis po rnams dang rnam par bral ba de'i phyir na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir na sna tshogs pa'i srid pa 'di yang ji lta ba'i rang bzhin gyis rab tu gsal bas na bcom ldan 'das 'di yang dngos po dang / dngos po med pa'i 'gro ba rkun gyi rang bzhin des rab tu gsal bar mi 'gyur te de'i rang bzhin gnyis po rnams dang rnam par bral ba de'i phyir na'o //
translated: Therefore, since this variety of existence is clearly manifest by the nature of things as they are, this Blessed One is not clearly manifest by the nature of things as they are.

original: de nas yang de gzhan gyi rang bzhin du rig par 'jug go zhes smra na /
analyzed: de nas yang de gzhan gyi rang bzhin du rig par 'jug go zhes smra na /
translated: If one says that it is known as having another nature,

original: de'i tshe srid pa rnams 'dir rig par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe srid pa rnams 'dir rig par mi 'gyur te /
translated: then existence would not be known here.

original: 'ga' zhig tu yang gzhan nyid du rig par skyes pa min te gzhan gyi rang bzhin du rig par ni de de'i ngo bo ma yin te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu yang gzhan nyid du rig par skyes pa min te gzhan gyi rang bzhin du rig par ni de de'i ngo bo ma yin te /
translated: It is not born as known as something else anywhere, and it is not known as having another nature, because it is not of that nature.

original: ji ltar bum pa'i shes pa ni snam bu'i shes pa gyur pa rigs pa ma yin no zhes pa 'di dag ni brgal ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar bum pa'i shes pa ni snam bu'i shes pa gyur pa rigs pa ma yin no zhes pa 'di dag ni brgal ba'o //
translated: Just as it is not reasonable for the cognition of a pot to be the cognition of a cloth.🔽This is the argument.

original: de kho na nyid de'i rang bzhin shes pa yin pas 'di ltar srid pa ste /
analyzed: de kho na nyid de'i rang bzhin shes pa yin pas 'di ltar srid pa ste /
translated: Since it is the cognition of the nature of reality, existence is like this.

original: 'dir shes pa'i ngo bo yin na yang 'on kyang rang gi ngo bo des de bzhin du rang ma shes pa'i rgyu yis g-yogs pas gzhan dag tu gsal bar shes pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir shes pa'i ngo bo yin na yang 'on kyang rang gi ngo bo des de bzhin du rang ma shes pa'i rgyu yis g-yogs pas gzhan dag tu gsal bar shes pa yin no //
translated: Here, although it is the nature of consciousness, still, because it is covered by the cause of not knowing itself in that way, it is known as something else.

original: de nyid kyi na kun rdzob ces bya ste 'khor ba la byar brjod la de yang 'dis de kho na nyid la kun nas bkab cing bsgribs pas na kun @160b rdzob ces bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi na kun rdzob ces bya ste 'khor ba la byar brjod la de yang 'dis de kho na nyid la kun nas bkab cing bsgribs pas na kun @160b rdzob ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called “conventional,” which is said to be saṃsāra. And that is called “conventional” because it completely covers and obscures reality.

original: gang gi tshe yang de kho na nyid 'dis nges par rig par gyur na ni rang gi rang bzhin nyid du gyur pas na de'i tshe ji ltar 'khor bar kun du 'jug / de'i phyir na gang yang gzhan gyi rang bzhin du de rig pa 'di ni log
analyzed: gang gi tshe yang de kho na nyid 'dis nges par rig par gyur na ni rang gi rang bzhin nyid du gyur pas na de'i tshe ji ltar 'khor bar kun du 'jug / de'i phyir na gang yang gzhan gyi rang bzhin du de rig pa 'di ni log
translated: But when it becomes ascertained by this reality, it becomes one’s own nature. At that time, how could it engage in saṃsāra? Therefore, that which is known as something else is mistaken.

original: pa'i lta ba'i skyon gyi 'khor ba'o //
analyzed: pa'i lta ba'i skyon gyi 'khor ba'o //
translated: This is the fault of wrong views in saṃsāra.

original: de yang dper na rab rib can gyi mig gis nam mkha' dri ma med pa la yang skra shad 'dzings pa la sogs pa dang ldan par snang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: de yang dper na rab rib can gyi mig gis nam mkha' dri ma med pa la yang skra shad 'dzings pa la sogs pa dang ldan par snang ba bzhin no //
translated: Moreover, it is like, for example, the eyes of one with cataracts seeing a whirling firebrand and so on as possessing faults in the stainless sky.

original: de la gzhan pa'i des de rab tu shes na de ji ltar shes pa yin te gang gis na de nyid du shes pa zhes bya ba 'di don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pas sngon du brjod pa de dag sun dbyung bar bya bar gnas pa ma🔽yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de la gzhan pa'i des de rab tu shes na de ji ltar shes pa yin te gang gis na de nyid du shes pa zhes bya ba 'di don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pas sngon du brjod pa de dag sun dbyung bar bya bar gnas pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Since this is not the meaning of “it knows that,” the previous statements are not established as refutations.🔽This is not so. The reality called “it fully knows the other” is by nature fully known in all ways. What is accepted?

original: min te gzhan du rab tu shes pa zhes bya ba'i de kho na nyid 'di ni rang bzhin gyis thams cad du de ltar rab tu shes pas khas blangs sam ci gang gis gzhan rab tu shes na ji ltar de'i rang bzhin rab tu shes pa ci zhes
analyzed: min te gzhan du rab tu shes pa zhes bya ba'i de kho na nyid 'di ni rang bzhin gyis thams cad du de ltar rab tu shes pas khas blangs sam ci gang gis gzhan rab tu shes na ji ltar de'i rang bzhin rab tu shes pa ci zhes
translated: If it fully knows the other, how does it fully know its own nature?

original: bya ba'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bya ba'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: What is the fault of saying “it”?

original: gal te de bzhin du gyur na ni de srid par yang ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te de bzhin du gyur na ni de srid par yang ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: If it were so, then how could it be possible?

original: de'i phyir na de ji ltar ba'i rang bzhin du mi shes pas 'di srid pa'i ngo bor 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir na de ji ltar ba'i rang bzhin du mi shes pas 'di srid pa'i ngo bor 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, since it does not know its own nature, it becomes the entity of possibility.

original: srid pa lugs su 'byung ba 'di dag kun kyang bag chags kyi ling tog gis lag pas byas pa bzhin du brdzun gyi rnam par kun du 'byung ngo //
analyzed: srid pa lugs su 'byung ba 'di dag kun kyang bag chags kyi ling tog gis lag pas byas pa bzhin du brdzun gyi rnam par kun du 'byung ngo //
translated: All these things that occur in the order of existence arise in the form of a lie, as if made by the hand of the cataract of traces.

original: de lta bu de dag dang ci zhig las she na /
analyzed: de lta bu de dag dang ci zhig las she na /
translated: From what are they like that?

original: sngon gyi las kyi rnam par smin pa'i stobs las skye ste /
analyzed: sngon gyi las kyi rnam par smin pa'i stobs las skye ste /
translated: They arise from the power of the ripening of past karma.

original: de ltar khas len pa los kyang mod de ji srid du 'khor ba'i rjes su 'jug pas yid rjes su 'jug go //
analyzed: de ltar khas len pa los kyang mod de ji srid du 'khor ba'i rjes su 'jug pas yid rjes su 'jug go //
translated: Even though one accepts that, the mind follows after as long as it engages in cyclic existence.

original: de'i phyir na smig rgyu ba'i dngos po la chu'i rnam par shes pa ltar 'dir de kho na nyid rang bzhin srid pa'i dngos por snang ba la 'gal ba 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir na smig rgyu ba'i dngos po la chu'i rnam par shes pa ltar 'dir de kho na nyid rang bzhin srid pa'i dngos por snang ba la 'gal ba 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, just as a consciousness of water occurs with respect to the thing that is a mirage, here there is no contradiction at all with respect to the appearance of the thing of existence, the nature of reality.

original: des na de 'khor ba yin par gyur pas na des ji lta ba'i smig rgyu la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ma shes pas brdzun gyi ngo bor rtogs pa 'ga' zhig tu skye bar 'gyur ba bzhin de kho na nyid la de ji ltar rig pa yin pa zhig
analyzed: des na de 'khor ba yin par gyur pas na des ji lta ba'i smig rgyu la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ma shes pas brdzun gyi ngo bor rtogs pa 'ga' zhig tu skye bar 'gyur ba bzhin de kho na nyid la de ji ltar rig pa yin pa zhig
translated: Therefore, since that is cyclic existence, it is like the arising of some false entity due to not knowing the nature of a mirage, etc.

original: na ste / de ji srid du de kho na nyid rab tu gsal ba na mya ngan 'das pa zhes bya ba yin par khas len pa lta los kyang mod kyi /🔽gzhan bdag gis kyang ni 'ga' zhig tu mya ngan las @161a * //
analyzed: na ste / de ji srid du de kho na nyid rab tu gsal ba na mya ngan 'das pa zhes bya ba yin par khas len pa lta los kyang mod kyi / gzhan bdag gis kyang ni 'ga' zhig tu mya ngan las @161a * //
translated: But as long as that is not illuminated by reality, it is called “cyclic existence.”

original: 'das par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'das par 'gyur ro //
translated: But also, at some point, it will be liberated by me.

original: des na ji lta ba'i rang bzhin rab tu ma shes pas kyang de rang rig pa tsam nyid las ji bzhin pas rang rang gi mya ngan las 'das pa'i go 'phang thams cad thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na ji lta ba'i rang bzhin rab tu ma shes pas kyang de rang rig pa tsam nyid las ji bzhin pas rang rang gi mya ngan las 'das pa'i go 'phang thams cad thob par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, even those who do not know the nature of reality will attain their own state of nirvana just as it is, merely through self-awareness.

original: ji ltar yul na ri ke la'i gling nas 'ongs ma thag pa'i mis me 'di'i rang bzhin ni sreg par byed pa yin no zhes bya bar mi shes kyang de yang dag par rig cing myang ba na grang ba sel bar mi 'gyur ram /
analyzed: ji ltar yul na ri ke la'i gling nas 'ongs ma thag pa'i mis me 'di'i rang bzhin ni sreg par byed pa yin no zhes bya bar mi shes kyang de yang dag par rig cing myang ba na grang ba sel bar mi 'gyur ram /
translated: Just as a person who has just arrived from the island of Rākṣasas in the south does not know the nature of fire to be burning, but when he correctly knows and tastes it, will he not dispel the cold?

original: de'i steng du yang dag par reg na sreg par yang mi 'gyur ram ci de bzhin du bca' sga 'dra bar rig nas dug tu ma shes pas zos na kha chu 'dzag cing brgyal ba la sogs pa'i bya ba rnams byed par mi 'gyur ram ci /
analyzed: de'i steng du yang dag par reg na sreg par yang mi 'gyur ram ci de bzhin du bca' sga 'dra bar rig nas dug tu ma shes pas zos na kha chu 'dzag cing brgyal ba la sogs pa'i bya ba rnams byed par mi 'gyur ram ci /
translated: Moreover, when he correctly touches it, will he not be burned? In the same way, if one eats asafoetida thinking it is similar to ginger, not knowing it is poison, will he not perform the functions of drooling and fainting?

original: de'i phyir na de kho na nyid kyis rang bzhin de ji lta ba'i rang bzhin du des mi shes pas 'khor ba yin la gzhan ni rang bzhin khong du chud pas so zhes pa 'di rigs pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir na de kho na nyid kyis rang bzhin de ji lta ba'i rang bzhin du des mi shes pas 'khor ba yin la gzhan ni rang bzhin khong du chud pas so zhes pa 'di rigs pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, since one does not know the nature of reality as it is, one cycles in samsara. It is illogical to say that others understand the nature of reality.”

original: de ni min te de kho na nyid kyi ye shes de ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes na yang rang rang gi dgos pas 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid de /🔽ci ming gi tshig de gang zhig gzhan rab tu gsal ba na gzhan po de rang rab tu gsal bde de'i dgos par 'byung ba min nam ci 'o na de'i tshe thams cad la kho na nyid rig pa yod pas srid pa rnam par bcad mi dgos par
analyzed: de ni min te de kho na nyid kyi ye shes de ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes na yang rang rang gi dgos pas 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid de / ci ming gi tshig de gang zhig gzhan rab tu gsal ba na gzhan po de rang rab tu gsal bde de'i dgos par 'byung ba min nam ci 'o na de'i tshe thams cad la kho na nyid rig pa yod pas srid pa rnam par bcad mi dgos par
translated: That is not so. Even if one fully understands the wisdom of thatness, one still engages in one’s own purpose.🔽If the word that illuminates one thing also illuminates another, is that not the purpose of the other?

original: 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Well then, since everyone would have the knowledge of thatness at that time, it would be unnecessary to eliminate existence.

original: min te de kho na nyid nyams su myong ba tsam gyis srid pa'i dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur bar brjod pa ni min te /
analyzed: min te de kho na nyid nyams su myong ba tsam gyis srid pa'i dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur bar brjod pa ni min te /
translated: That is not so. It is not being said that the mere experience of thatness is nirvana, which is characterized by the nonexistence of the things of existence.

original: gang de tsam gyis ni mya ngan las 'das par sbyor bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang de tsam gyis ni mya ngan las 'das par sbyor bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: That alone does not lead to nirvana.

original: de kho na nyid shes pas mya ngan las 'das par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de kho na nyid shes pas mya ngan las 'das par mi 'gyur /
translated: Nirvana is not achieved through the knowledge of thatness.

original: mi 'gyur ba gang gi tshe gang zhig gang gis 'gyur ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba gang gi tshe gang zhig gang gis 'gyur ba yin zhe na /
translated: If it is not so, then when and by what is it achieved?

original: de kho na nyid du rig pa de nyid las so //
analyzed: de kho na nyid du rig pa de nyid las so //
translated: It is from that very awareness of suchness.

original: ci zhig na de'i tshe yang thams cad du srid pa med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig na de'i tshe yang thams cad du srid pa med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then at that time, too, everything would be nonexistent.

original: min te ji bzhin pa'i rang bzhin du de nges par rig par ma byas pas te /
analyzed: min te ji bzhin pa'i rang bzhin du de nges par rig par ma byas pas te /
translated: No, it is not so, because the nature of things as they are has not been ascertained.🔽When the nature of things as they are is realized, that is called nirvana.

original: ji lta ba'i rang bzhin du rtogs pa gang gi tshe de de kho na nyid du rtogs pa de'i tshe mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya bar gzhag par brjod kyi srid pa'i rgya mtshor zhugs pa'i sems can rnams kyis ni de'i rang bzhin ji lta ba bzhin
analyzed: ji lta ba'i rang bzhin du rtogs pa gang gi tshe de de kho na nyid du rtogs pa de'i tshe mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya bar gzhag par brjod kyi srid pa'i rgya mtshor zhugs pa'i sems can rnams kyis ni de'i rang bzhin ji lta ba bzhin
translated: But sentient beings who are immersed in the ocean of existence do not understand the nature of things as it is.

original: du khong du chud pa yod pa min pa gang gis na thams cad mya @161b ngan las 'das par ma gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: du khong du chud pa yod pa min pa gang gis na thams cad mya @161b ngan las 'das par ma gyur pa yin te /
translated: So how could it be that everyone is not in nirvana?

original: gnyis su med pa'i dngos po nyid la gnyis kyi rjes su zhugs pa'i phyir na de brdzun pa'i blor gnas pa ci ste min /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i dngos po nyid la gnyis kyi rjes su zhugs pa'i phyir na de brdzun pa'i blor gnas pa ci ste min /
translated: Since they engage in duality in the nature that is nondual, how could it not be that they abide in a false understanding?

original: des na ji ltar de kho na nyid kyi rang bzhin yongs su ma rig pa'i sems can rnams la ji ltar yod par brjod /
analyzed: des na ji ltar de kho na nyid kyi rang bzhin yongs su ma rig pa'i sems can rnams la ji ltar yod par brjod /
translated: Therefore, how can it be said that it exists for sentient beings who do not fully understand the nature of reality?

original: 'o na mya ngan las 'das pa las ma rtogs pa'i de kho na nyid kyi dgos par bya ba ji lta bu zhig 'thob /
analyzed: 'o na mya ngan las 'das pa las ma rtogs pa'i de kho na nyid kyi dgos par bya ba ji lta bu zhig 'thob /
translated: Well then, what is the purpose of nirvana, which is not the realization of reality?

original: gang yang de shes pa la mya ngan las 'das pa mi 'byung na gzhan zhig las dgos pa de 'byung bar gzhag gam zhe na /🔽min te de las gzhan pa de yang yod pa yin la thun mong ba'i dgos pa'i mtshan nyid rang rig ba'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba thams cad pa nyid kyi ye shes rang rig pa zhes bya ba thun mong ba'i dgos pa nyid sngon po dang /
analyzed: gang yang de shes pa la mya ngan las 'das pa mi 'byung na gzhan zhig las dgos pa de 'byung bar gzhag gam zhe na / min te de las gzhan pa de yang yod pa yin la thun mong ba'i dgos pa'i mtshan nyid rang rig ba'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba thams cad pa nyid kyi ye shes rang rig pa zhes bya ba thun mong ba'i dgos pa nyid sngon po dang /
translated: If nirvana does not arise from the knowledge of that, is it posited that that purpose arises from something else?

original: ser po la sogs pa'i rnam pa bye brag tu rtogs pa'i khyad par nyid do //
analyzed: ser po la sogs pa'i rnam pa bye brag tu rtogs pa'i khyad par nyid do //
translated: No, because that which is other than that also exists. The characteristic of the common purpose is called the nature of reflexive awareness. The knowledge of all things is called reflexive awareness. The common purpose itself is the specific realization of the aspects such as blue and yellow.

original: des na de kho na nyid kyi ye shes rang rig pa ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa sna tshogs pa'i gzugs kyis yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na de kho na nyid kyi ye shes rang rig pa ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa sna tshogs pa'i gzugs kyis yod pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the wisdom of reality is reflexive awareness, which exists in the form of various things and nonthings.

original: de'i dgos pa khyad par can ni /
analyzed: de'i dgos pa khyad par can ni /
translated: Its special purpose is

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshan de don gyi rang bzhin pa khyad par du rtogs pa yin pa 'di la the tshom med do //🔽'o na ci mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin rang rig pa'i min pa gang gis na rang rig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dgos pa las 'di khyad par ru so sor brjod pa de bzhin du yin na ni brgya la lan 'ga' zhig na'ang mya ngan las 'das
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshan de don gyi rang bzhin pa khyad par du rtogs pa yin pa 'di la the tshom med do // 'o na ci mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin rang rig pa'i min pa gang gis na rang rig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dgos pa las 'di khyad par ru so sor brjod pa de bzhin du yin na ni brgya la lan 'ga' zhig na'ang mya ngan las 'das
translated: to realize the nature of the reality of nirvāṇa. There is no doubt about this.

original: pa ni rtogs pa'i bdag nyid du mi 'gyur te rang rig pa'i rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa ni rtogs pa'i bdag nyid du mi 'gyur te rang rig pa'i rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Well, if nirvāṇa is not reflexive awareness, how is it that it is described as a special purpose that is characterized by reflexive awareness? If it were like that, then nirvāṇa would never be realized as having the nature of reflexive awareness, because it would not have the nature of reflexive awareness.

original: rang rig pa'i las gzhan pa gang zhig tu yang de ji ltar rig par byed pa 'di ci rigs des na bum pa la sogs pa yang rang bzhin gyis rig pa med de bems po tsam gyis gsal bar skye ba med pa nyid dam ci mya ngan las
analyzed: rang rig pa'i las gzhan pa gang zhig tu yang de ji ltar rig par byed pa 'di ci rigs des na bum pa la sogs pa yang rang bzhin gyis rig pa med de bems po tsam gyis gsal bar skye ba med pa nyid dam ci mya ngan las
translated: Therefore, a pot and so on are not intrinsically cognized, because they are simply insentient and do not arise as clarity.🔽What is this?

original: 'das pa 'di yang de bzhin yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'das pa 'di yang de bzhin yin no zhe na /
translated: It is nirvana.🔽No, because a consciousness that is the aspect of a pot is correctly produced by the conditions of the eye, ear, mental activity, and objects.

original: min te mig dang rna ba dang yid la byed pa dang yul rnams kyi rkyen gyis bum pa'i rnam pa'i shes pa yang dag par skyes nas rig pa las bum par rig go shes so zhes zer yang de nyid bems po yin pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: min te mig dang rna ba dang yid la byed pa dang yul rnams kyi rkyen gyis bum pa'i rnam pa'i shes pa yang dag par skyes nas rig pa las bum par rig go shes so zhes zer yang de nyid bems po yin pa'i phyir na /
translated: It is said, “It is cognized from being cognized by that,” but that is insentient.

original: gzhan dag byed pa'i dngos po'i gsal ba med pa de bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa yang yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan dag byed pa'i dngos po'i gsal ba med pa de bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa yang yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, just as the clarity of an object that is a product of something else does not exist, so too nirvana is like that.

original: min te de ni ye shes kyi @162a * //
analyzed: min te de ni ye shes kyi @162a * //
translated: No, because that is wisdom.

original: rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ye shes kyi bdag nyid la yang ye shes gzhan zhig gis shes par byed pa ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ye shes kyi bdag nyid la yang ye shes gzhan zhig gis shes par byed pa ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not logical that the nature of pristine consciousness is known by another pristine consciousness, because it is the nature itself.

original: de la yang gzhan pa'i ye shes zhig dgos la /
analyzed: de la yang gzhan pa'i ye shes zhig dgos la /
translated: In that case, another pristine consciousness is needed,

original: de la yang gzhan pa zhig dgos pas thug pa med pa'i skyon du gnas so //
analyzed: de la yang gzhan pa zhig dgos pas thug pa med pa'i skyon du gnas so //
translated: and in that case, another one is needed, so the fault of infinite regress remains.

original: de nas yang gal te mya ngan las 'das pa yang ye shes kyi rang bzhin no zhes zer na /
analyzed: de nas yang gal te mya ngan las 'das pa yang ye shes kyi rang bzhin no zhes zer na /
translated: Moreover, if you say that nirvana is also the nature of pristine consciousness,

original: ci da ni mya ngan las 'das pa yang bems po'i bdag nyid du smra'am de lta bu bdag nyid yin par smra'o zhe na /
analyzed: ci da ni mya ngan las 'das pa yang bems po'i bdag nyid du smra'am de lta bu bdag nyid yin par smra'o zhe na /
translated: do you say that nirvana is now the nature of an inanimate object?

original: 'o na bum pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid thams cad kyang mya ngan las 'das pa yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na bum pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid thams cad kyang mya ngan las 'das pa yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you say that, then the nature of all things, such as a vase, would be nirvana.

original: de ltar gyur na ni 'gro ba thams cad 'bad pa mi dgos par yongs su grol bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na ni 'gro ba thams cad 'bad pa mi dgos par yongs su grol bar 'gyur te /
translated: If that were the case, all transmigrating beings would be completely liberated without needing to make effort.

original: bum pa la sogs pa thams cad kyang de lta bu nyid kyi rang bzhin du gnas pa dang / bems po'i rang bzhin nyid kyis na /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa thams cad kyang de lta bu nyid kyi rang bzhin du gnas pa dang / bems po'i rang bzhin nyid kyis na /
translated: All things such as pots, etc. are also present in that very nature, and because of the nature of matter,

original: bum pa la sogs pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa ni khyad par 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa ni khyad par 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: there is not even the slightest difference between a pot, etc. and nirvana.

original: de nas yang mya ngan las 'das pa ye shes kyi rang bzhin yin na yang srid pa'i dngos po dus thams cad du ye med pa'i skyon du gnas pa nyid de sngon po la sogs pa'i shes pa rnams de bzhin par dus thams cad du yod pa ste
analyzed: de nas yang mya ngan las 'das pa ye shes kyi rang bzhin yin na yang srid pa'i dngos po dus thams cad du ye med pa'i skyon du gnas pa nyid de sngon po la sogs pa'i shes pa rnams de bzhin par dus thams cad du yod pa ste
translated: Then, even if nirvana is the nature of wisdom, the fault of the existence of the thing of cyclic existence being utterly nonexistent at all times remains, because the consciousnesses of blue, etc. are like that, existing at all times.

original: / ye shes nyid yin pa ni sngon po la sogs pa'i shes pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i shes pa dag la 'ga' zhig dang khyad par du 'jug pa med pas na'o zhe na'o //
analyzed: / ye shes nyid yin pa ni sngon po la sogs pa'i shes pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i shes pa dag la 'ga' zhig dang khyad par du 'jug pa med pas na'o zhe na'o //
translated: The fact that it is wisdom is because there is no difference whatsoever between the consciousness of blue, etc. and the consciousness of nirvana.

original: min te mya ngan las 'das pa'i ye shes ni de kho na nyid kyi ye shes las skye bar 'gyur gyi ye shes min pa skye mi srid pa dang / shes pa'i bya ba shas pa ma yin pa ni shin tu mi rigs te rgyu'i bye brag gis bye brag tu byas na 'bras bu bye brag tu dbye ba yin te /
analyzed: min te mya ngan las 'das pa'i ye shes ni de kho na nyid kyi ye shes las skye bar 'gyur gyi ye shes min pa skye mi srid pa dang / shes pa'i bya ba shas pa ma yin pa ni shin tu mi rigs te rgyu'i bye brag gis bye brag tu byas na 'bras bu bye brag tu dbye ba yin te /
translated: It is utterly illogical for the action of consciousness to be something other than cognition, because if it were, the effect would be differentiated by the specific cause.

original: ji ltar skud pa nag po btags pa las snam bu dkar por gyur srid pa ni med pa dang / 'jib las snod du byas na zangs kyi snod du 'gyur ba med pa des na de kho na nyid kyi ye shes kyi dgos pa rang rig pa'i mtshan nyid dang /
analyzed: ji ltar skud pa nag po btags pa las snam bu dkar por gyur srid pa ni med pa dang / 'jib las snod du byas na zangs kyi snod du 'gyur ba med pa des na de kho na nyid kyi ye shes kyi dgos pa rang rig pa'i mtshan nyid dang /
translated: Just as it is impossible for a white cloth to come from a black thread, or for a copper vessel to come from a clay mold, the purpose of the gnosis of thatness is the defining characteristic of reflexive awareness.

original: de las gzhan yang khyad par can gyi mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid ji lta ba'i rang bzhin khong du chud pa'o zhes gzhag par bya ba 'di dag ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: de las gzhan yang khyad par can gyi mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid ji lta ba'i rang bzhin khong du chud pa'o zhes gzhag par bya ba 'di dag ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: Moreover, it is to be understood that the defining characteristic of nirvana, which is superior to that, is the nature of just what is.

original: 'di la smras @162b pa de kho na nyid kyi ye shes kyi dgos pa rang rig pa las mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dgos pa 'di rang rig pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gzhan du 'gyur bar skye ba med pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di la smras @162b pa de kho na nyid kyi ye shes kyi dgos pa rang rig pa las mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dgos pa 'di rang rig pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gzhan du 'gyur bar skye ba med pa nyid do //
translated: Here, it is said that the purpose of the wisdom of thatness is the purpose of the characteristic of nirvana, which is not a nature that is other than reflexive awareness. It is not born as something else.

original: ci rang rig pa las gzhan pa na rang rig pa ma yin par 'gyur ba yin pas 'gal lo zhe na ;
analyzed: ci rang rig pa las gzhan pa na rang rig pa ma yin par 'gyur ba yin pas 'gal lo zhe na ;
translated: If it is asked, “Is it contradictory because it is not reflexive awareness, but something other than reflexive awareness?”

original: min te mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dgos pa de nyid kyi rang rig pa yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: min te mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dgos pa de nyid kyi rang rig pa yin pa kho na'o //
translated: It is not so. That very purpose of the characteristic of nirvana is reflexive awareness itself.

original: 'di ji lta bu zhig na /
analyzed: 'di ji lta bu zhig na /
translated: What is it like?

original: rang rig pa'i dgos pa dang zhes dbye bar yod pa de dang / gzhan pa'i dgos pa 'di yang rang rig pa yin par khas blangs pa 'dis ni gnyis su dbye ba 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: rang rig pa'i dgos pa dang zhes dbye bar yod pa de dang / gzhan pa'i dgos pa 'di yang rang rig pa yin par khas blangs pa 'dis ni gnyis su dbye ba 'gal lo zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, “Since there is a division into the purpose of reflexive awareness and this other purpose, is it contradictory that both are asserted to be reflexive awareness?”

original: min te rang rig pa zhes bya ba tsam gyis thams cad rang rig pa zhes bya ba'i dngos po gcig tu 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: min te rang rig pa zhes bya ba tsam gyis thams cad rang rig pa zhes bya ba'i dngos po gcig tu 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not so. Merely calling it “reflexive awareness” does not make everything a single entity called “reflexive awareness.”

original: rang rang gi dbye bas so sor phye ba'i phyir na sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i rang rig pa'i shes pa tsam gyis rang rang gi ngo bo de gcig tu 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rang rang gi dbye bas so sor phye ba'i phyir na sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i rang rig pa'i shes pa tsam gyis rang rang gi ngo bo de gcig tu 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Because of the distinctions of each of them, the individual distinctions are made. Therefore, the mere consciousness that is self-aware of blue, yellow, and so on is not the same in terms of its individual natures.

original: de'i phyir na de kho na nyid kyi ye shes kyi dgos pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid ni rang rig pa tsam thun mong pa de las dbye bar gnas pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir na de kho na nyid kyi ye shes kyi dgos pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid ni rang rig pa tsam thun mong pa de las dbye bar gnas pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the purpose of the wisdom of suchness, the characteristic of nirvana, is to distinguish it from that common mere self-awareness.

original: des rang rig pa tsam gyis srid pa'i dngos po yang thams cad du rab tu dbye bar gnas pa nyid do //
analyzed: des rang rig pa tsam gyis srid pa'i dngos po yang thams cad du rab tu dbye bar gnas pa nyid do //
translated: By that, the entities of existence are also distinguished in every way by mere self-awareness.

original: des na mya ngan las 'das pa khong du chud pa yang rang rig pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir na yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na mya ngan las 'das pa khong du chud pa yang rang rig pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir na yod pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the understanding of nirvana also exists because of the nature of self-awareness.

original: de kho na nyid kyi rang bzhin ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa las mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ba yin no zhes smra na /
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi rang bzhin ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa las mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ba yin no zhes smra na /
translated: If one says that nirvana comes from realizing the nature of suchness just as it is,

original: ci 'dod pa tsam gyis rab tu smra bar byed pa 'dir 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci 'dod pa tsam gyis rab tu smra bar byed pa 'dir 'gyur te /
translated: then this would be mere idle talk.

original: de kho na nyid ces pa dang ; mya ngan las 'das pa zhas bya ba dang / grol ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji srid pa de dag ni ming gi rnam grangs tsam yin na bya ba dang byed pa gnyis su gzhag pa de dag gis rab tu smras pa de ji ltar legs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de kho na nyid ces pa dang ; mya ngan las 'das pa zhas bya ba dang / grol ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji srid pa de dag ni ming gi rnam grangs tsam yin na bya ba dang byed pa gnyis su gzhag pa de dag gis rab tu smras pa de ji ltar legs pa yin zhe na /
translated: As many as there are synonyms such as “reality,” “nirvana,” “liberation,” and so on, they are merely nominal. How can it be good to posit them as two, action and agent?

original: gang yang don dam pa la ni khyad par med pa de bzhin na yang kun rdzob la brten nas kun rdzob tsam du gzhag pa'i rtog pa nyid bya ba dang byed pa la sogs par dbye ba thams cad kun rdzob tsam du gnas kyi don dam pa la🔽ni bya ba dang byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gnyis su dbye ba rnams 'ga' yang med de /
analyzed: gang yang don dam pa la ni khyad par med pa de bzhin na yang kun rdzob la brten nas kun rdzob tsam du gzhag pa'i rtog pa nyid bya ba dang byed pa la sogs par dbye ba thams cad kun rdzob tsam du gnas kyi don dam pa la ni bya ba dang byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gnyis su dbye ba rnams 'ga' yang med de /
translated: Although there is no difference in the ultimate, still, in dependence on the conventional, all the divisions of action, agent, and so on are posited as mere conventions.

original: bka' las blo @163a * //
analyzed: bka' las blo @163a * //
translated: In the ultimate, there are no divisions whatsoever called “action” and “agent” and so on.

original: gros chen po chos thams cad ni skye ba med pa ste bden pa dang bden pa min pa gnyis kar ma skyes pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gros chen po chos thams cad ni skye ba med pa ste bden pa dang bden pa min pa gnyis kar ma skyes pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: The scriptures say, “Mahamati, all phenomena are unarisen, not arisen as either true or not true.”

original: de'i phyir na bag chags dang rnam par bral ba las ji lta ba bzhin gyi de kho na nyid kyi ye shes pa la yang dag par rig pa'i de ma thag par mya ngan las 'das pa los kyang mos te sa bon des de bzhin du kun rdzob
analyzed: de'i phyir na bag chags dang rnam par bral ba las ji lta ba bzhin gyi de kho na nyid kyi ye shes pa la yang dag par rig pa'i de ma thag par mya ngan las 'das pa los kyang mos te sa bon des de bzhin du kun rdzob
translated: That seed is merely a conventional

original: tsam du byas pa la bya'o //
analyzed: tsam du byas pa la bya'o //
translated: act.

original: de yang ji ltar rab tu dga' ba las 'drangs  par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i kun rdzob tu grub pa de'i rab tu dga' ba dang 'drangs  pa dag ni mya ngan las 'das pa gzhan na 'ga' yang med kyang de ltar grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang ji ltar rab tu dga' ba las 'drangs  par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i kun rdzob tu grub pa de'i rab tu dga' ba dang 'drangs  pa dag ni mya ngan las 'das pa gzhan na 'ga' yang med kyang de ltar grub pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, just as one is satisfied by the joy of the first ground, the conventional establishment of that joy and satisfaction of the first ground are not at all elsewhere in nirvana, but they are established in that way.

original: 'o na mya ngan las 'das pa'i sngon du rtogs pa nyid ji ltar skye zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na mya ngan las 'das pa'i sngon du rtogs pa nyid ji ltar skye zhe na /
translated: Well then, how does realization itself arise prior to nirvana?

original: de la smras pa /
analyzed: de la smras pa /
translated: To that it is said:

original: rang rig pa'i rang bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: rang rig pa'i rang bzhin no zhe na /
translated: The nature of self-awareness.

original: min te rang rig pa 'di gang gis dgos pas ye shes kyi rang bzhin gang de srid pa 'dir 'di'i rang bzhin ston cig / rig pa'i rang bzhin de mi shes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: min te rang rig pa 'di gang gis dgos pas ye shes kyi rang bzhin gang de srid pa 'dir 'di'i rang bzhin ston cig / rig pa'i rang bzhin de mi shes par 'gyur te /
translated: If you do not know the nature of reflexive awareness,

original: ji ltar bum pa'i mgrin pa la sogs pa rnams mi shes par bum pa shes so zhes bya bar mi 'gyur bas 'di'i rang bzhin dngos po can zhig tu dmigs par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: ji ltar bum pa'i mgrin pa la sogs pa rnams mi shes par bum pa shes so zhes bya bar mi 'gyur bas 'di'i rang bzhin dngos po can zhig tu dmigs par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: then just as one cannot say, “I know the pot,” without knowing the neck and so on of the pot, you must observe the nature of this reflexive awareness.🔽Show us whether it is an entity or a nonentity.

original: 'on te dngos po med pa can zhig tu dmigs par 'gyur ba ston cig / de la dngos po'i phyogs su gnas na ni gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang rnam par bral ba'i sbyor bas de kho na nyid kyang rab tu mi gnas pa kho nar 'gyur
analyzed: 'on te dngos po med pa can zhig tu dmigs par 'gyur ba ston cig / de la dngos po'i phyogs su gnas na ni gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang rnam par bral ba'i sbyor bas de kho na nyid kyang rab tu mi gnas pa kho nar 'gyur
translated: If it is an entity, then the argument that it is devoid of the nature of being one or many will apply, and so it will not be tenable that it is reality.

original: ro // dngos po med par rjes su gnas na yang dngos po med pa ni dngos po sngon du 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: ro // dngos po med par rjes su gnas na yang dngos po med pa ni dngos po sngon du 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir na /
translated: If it is a nonentity, then since a nonentity must be preceded by an entity,

original: dngos po nyid de ltar med pas dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin ji ltar yod par ston /
analyzed: dngos po nyid de ltar med pas dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin ji ltar yod par ston /
translated: Since things do not exist in that way, how could the nature of nonthings exist?🔽If you say that the nature of both is called “freedom from the nature of duality,”

original: de nas gnyis ka'i rang bzhin rnam par bral ba zhes bya ba de kho na nyid yin par ston no zhe na /
analyzed: de nas gnyis ka'i rang bzhin rnam par bral ba zhes bya ba de kho na nyid yin par ston no zhe na /
translated: then that is the suchness.

original: de ltar na yang rig pa dang ldan pa'i dngos po des na ye shes de skye ba dang ldan pa'i phyir na dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i rang bzhin gyis na dngos po nyid du gyur pas thams cad du bya ba dang byed pa'i dngos po can gyi mtshan🔽nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na yang rig pa dang ldan pa'i dngos po des na ye shes de skye ba dang ldan pa'i phyir na dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i rang bzhin gyis na dngos po nyid du gyur pas thams cad du bya ba dang byed pa'i dngos po can gyi mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: In that case, since that entity endowed with awareness is endowed with the arising of that wisdom, it has an entity that has an object. Therefore, in all cases, it has the characteristic of being an entity that is an agent and an object.

original: de nas yang ye shes 'di la skye ba med de de nyid rang rig pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de nas yang ye shes 'di la skye ba med de de nyid rang rig pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that this wisdom does not arise because it is the nature of reflexive awareness,

original: de ltar na de ni ye shes 'di bya ba rnams ci yang mi bskyed na ni de ji ltar yod pa ma @163b yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na de ni ye shes 'di bya ba rnams ci yang mi bskyed na ni de ji ltar yod pa ma @163b yin te /
translated: then if that wisdom does not produce any activity at all, how could it exist?

original: nus pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir mo gsham gyi bu bzhin na rig pa yin par ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: nus pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir mo gsham gyi bu bzhin na rig pa yin par ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: Because it is devoid of all potentiality, how could nirvana be cognition, like the son of a barren woman?

original: des na mya ngan las 'das pa de nus pa thams cad dang rnam par bral ba kho na'i stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na mya ngan las 'das pa de nus pa thams cad dang rnam par bral ba kho na'i stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, nirvana is only empty of all potentiality, the nature of emptiness.

original: de lta bu yin bzhin du yang de la rang rig de nges par yod pa yin na ni ye shes de bya ba dang byed pa la sogs pa can du khas blangs dgos so //
analyzed: de lta bu yin bzhin du yang de la rang rig de nges par yod pa yin na ni ye shes de bya ba dang byed pa la sogs pa can du khas blangs dgos so //
translated: If, in spite of this, reflexive awareness definitely exists in nirvana, then it must be accepted that this wisdom has activity, an agent, and so on.

original: de dag de ltar gyur na sngar gyi bzhin du dngos por dmigs pa'i skyon du 'gyur te dngos po ni bya ba dang byed pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag de ltar gyur na sngar gyi bzhin du dngos por dmigs pa'i skyon du 'gyur te dngos po ni bya ba dang byed pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If that were the case, then, as before, the error of observing things would ensue, because things are defined by activity and an agent.

original: de nas de bzhin du gnyis kyi rnam pa dang rnam par bral ba'i rang bzhin gyi phyir na /
analyzed: de nas de bzhin du gnyis kyi rnam pa dang rnam par bral ba'i rang bzhin gyi phyir na /
translated: Then, in the same way, because the nature of nirvana is free from the aspect of duality,

original: de kho na nyid de la de bzhin pa'i rang bzhin du rig pa yang med pa des na ye shes bya ba dang byed pa la sogs pa can gyi dngos por dmigs pa'i skyon du gnas pa ji tsam yod ce na /
analyzed: de kho na nyid de la de bzhin pa'i rang bzhin du rig pa yang med pa des na ye shes bya ba dang byed pa la sogs pa can gyi dngos por dmigs pa'i skyon du gnas pa ji tsam yod ce na /
translated: Since there is no such thing as a nature that is suchness, and since there is no awareness of suchness as a nature, how could there be any fault of observing things that possess such things as wisdom and activity?

original: de ltar na yang de bzhin pa'i rig pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: de ltar na yang de bzhin pa'i rig pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir na /
translated: Even so, since there is no entity that is suchness and awareness,

original: de de'i mya ngan las 'das pa ji lta bu zhig yod de /
analyzed: de de'i mya ngan las 'das pa ji lta bu zhig yod de /
translated: how could there be any such thing as nirvana?

original: mya ngan las 'das par yang so sor rig pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das par yang so sor rig pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: There would be the fault that nirvana would not be individually cognized.

original: min te ston cing brjod pa med ces te /
analyzed: min te ston cing brjod pa med ces te /
translated: It is not so, for it is said that it is not shown or expressed.

original: de med pas rang rig pa'i rang bzhin yang zhig ste med dam /
analyzed: de med pas rang rig pa'i rang bzhin yang zhig ste med dam /
translated: Since it does not exist, is the nature of reflexive awareness also destroyed and nonexistent?

original: ji ltar lkugs pa la sogs pas ro mchog myangs pa na ston par mi nus pa'i dngos po las ro myong ba med dam ci /
analyzed: ji ltar lkugs pa la sogs pas ro mchog myangs pa na ston par mi nus pa'i dngos po las ro myong ba med dam ci /
translated: Or, is it like the case of a mute tasting flavors, where there is no tasting of flavors due to the inability to show or express it?

original: nus pa rnam par mang gsungs pa //
analyzed: nus pa rnam par mang gsungs pa //
translated: It is said that the ability is manifold.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rgyud gzhan dag las rgyud 'di nyid khyad par du 'phags par gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rgyud gzhan dag las rgyud 'di nyid khyad par du 'phags par gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Thus, etc. is the statement that this very tantra is superior to other tantras.

original: rgyud 'dir gang gsungs pa'i sngags la sogs pa'i de kho na nyid ni thos pa tsam gyis 'grub par brjod de /
analyzed: rgyud 'dir gang gsungs pa'i sngags la sogs pa'i de kho na nyid ni thos pa tsam gyis 'grub par brjod de /
translated: The reality of the mantra, etc. taught in this tantra is said to be accomplished by mere hearing.

original: lan cig brjod pa de nyid kyis dngos grub stsol par mdzad pa dang / 'dir sngon du bsnyen pa yang mi dgos shing de bzhin du bzlas pa 'bum la sogs pa med par yang 'grub po //
analyzed: lan cig brjod pa de nyid kyis dngos grub stsol par mdzad pa dang / 'dir sngon du bsnyen pa yang mi dgos shing de bzhin du bzlas pa 'bum la sogs pa med par yang 'grub po //
translated: It is said that the mere recitation of it grants powers, and here there is no need for prior repetition, and likewise, it is accomplished without the hundred thousand repetitions, etc.

original: sku gzugs dag ni dags pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnal 'byor pas nus mthu rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i rang bzhin brjod pas sems can rnams gzhug par bya bar brjod do //
analyzed: sku gzugs dag ni dags pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnal 'byor pas nus mthu rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i rang bzhin brjod pas sems can rnams gzhug par bya bar brjod do //
translated: The images, etc. is the statement that the yogi/nī should engage sentient beings by describing the various kinds of powers.🔽Therefore, the images, etc. are not common

original: de'i phyir na sku gzugs dags pa la sogs pa ni de las gzhan pa @164a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir na sku gzugs dags pa la sogs pa ni de las gzhan pa @164a * //
translated: to others.

original: thun mong ma yin pa mthong bas gdul dka' ba'i sems can rnams 'dul bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa mthong bas gdul dka' ba'i sems can rnams 'dul bar 'gyur la /
translated: By seeing the uncommon, difficult to tame sentient beings are tamed.

original: des chos bstan pa'i snod du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des chos bstan pa'i snod du 'gyur ro //
translated: He becomes a vessel for the teaching of the Dharma.

original: rang gi gzugs ni bsgyur ba nyid //
analyzed: rang gi gzugs ni bsgyur ba nyid //
translated: One should transform one's own form.

original: ces bya ba ni so so'i ming gzugs por nas seng ge dang stag mo la sogs pa'i gzugs su byed pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni so so'i ming gzugs por nas seng ge dang stag mo la sogs pa'i gzugs su byed pa'o //
translated: Having changed one's own name, one should assume the form of a lion, tiger, and so on.

original: gzhan gyi grong du 'jug ces bya ba ni rang gi lus yongs su bor nas gzhan gyi lus kyi nang du rang gi rnam par shes pa 'jug par byed pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi grong du 'jug ces bya ba ni rang gi lus yongs su bor nas gzhan gyi lus kyi nang du rang gi rnam par shes pa 'jug par byed pa ste /
translated: One should enter another's town means that, having abandoned one's own body, one should cause one's consciousness to enter the body of another.

original: de dag la sogs pa'i nus pa thams cad byed par nus pa ni sangs rgyas thos pa'i rnal 'byor ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag la sogs pa'i nus pa thams cad byed par nus pa ni sangs rgyas thos pa'i rnal 'byor ba yin no //
translated: One who is a yogi of the Buddha's teachings is able to perform all these and other powers.

original: de nas gzhan yang bshad bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dug bsal ba dang / nus mthu 'phral du dbyung ba 'dir brjod cing ston to //
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang bshad bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dug bsal ba dang / nus mthu 'phral du dbyung ba 'dir brjod cing ston to //
translated: Now, moreover, what is to be explained, and so on, is stated here: the removal of poison, and the immediate manifestation of power.

original: de nas sbyor ba bco brgyad gsungs zhis bya ba ni zos te myong bar bslad par bya ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nas sbyor ba bco brgyad gsungs zhis bya ba ni zos te myong bar bslad par bya ba gsungs pa /
translated: Then, the eighteen applications are stated, beginning with having eaten, one should be made to experience.

original: sa li ka yi sbyor ba dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste gang gi tshe dus zos te myos par gyur pa de'i tshe ji skad du gsungs pa'i sa li ka la sogs pa'i sbyor ba rnams sngags pas bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sa li ka yi sbyor ba dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste gang gi tshe dus zos te myos par gyur pa de'i tshe ji skad du gsungs pa'i sa li ka la sogs pa'i sbyor ba rnams sngags pas bya ba yin no //
translated: The application of salīki, and so on. When the time has come and one is intoxicated, then the mantra practitioner should perform the applications of salīki and so on, as stated.

original: de nas rab tu sbyor ba byas ma thag tu zos pa rnams 'tsho'o //
analyzed: de nas rab tu sbyor ba byas ma thag tu zos pa rnams 'tsho'o //
translated: Then, immediately after performing the application, those who have eaten live.

original: rig pa 'dzin pa ni 'bras btags pa las rig pa 'dzin pa gnyis bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rig pa 'dzin pa ni 'bras btags pa las rig pa 'dzin pa gnyis bya ba yin no //
translated: The knowledge-holder is the one who performs the two actions of the knowledge-holder from the designated fruit.

original: rgyan po 'gyed dang zhes bya ba ni gang du zos pa 'di yod pa de la bsam gtan dang ldan pa'i sngags pas rgyan po rtse bar byas pa las de nas zos pa 'di 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyan po 'gyed dang zhes bya ba ni gang du zos pa 'di yod pa de la bsam gtan dang ldan pa'i sngags pas rgyan po rtse bar byas pa las de nas zos pa 'di 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Gambling means that in whatever place this food exists, the meditative mantra practitioner should play gambling games. Then, this food to be eaten will be obtained.

original: de nas rnga brdungs pa'i sbyor ba yis te de dag la sogs pa'i rab tu sbyor ba bco brgyad po sngags pas bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rnga brdungs pa'i sbyor ba yis te de dag la sogs pa'i rab tu sbyor ba bco brgyad po sngags pas bya'o //
translated: Then, by the application of beating the drum, and so on, the mantra practitioner should perform these eighteen applications.

original: mchog gi ye shes he ru ka'i dngos po de rab tu gsal bar gsungs pa /
analyzed: mchog gi ye shes he ru ka'i dngos po de rab tu gsal bar gsungs pa /
translated: The supreme wisdom Heruka's state is clearly stated:

original: de nas gzhan yang rab bshad pa //
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang rab bshad pa //
translated: Now, I will explain the other.🔽

original: ci bzhin de nyid ye shes mchog / ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ci bzhin de nyid ye shes mchog / ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, moreover, the supreme wisdom of reality just as it is, and so on.🔽The wisdom that is the nature of innate joy is indeed the place of movement in the form of semen inside the tip of the lotus of the wisdom .

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i rang bzhin gyi ye shes gang yin pa de shes rab kyi padma'i rtse'i nang na khu ba'i gzugs kyis rgyu ba'i gnas pa de yin mod kang sems can 'di dag thams cad ni ma rig pa'i mun pas g-yogs pas dmigs pa dang
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i rang bzhin gyi ye shes gang yin pa de shes rab kyi padma'i rtse'i nang na khu ba'i gzugs kyis rgyu ba'i gnas pa de yin mod kang sems can 'di dag thams cad ni ma rig pa'i mun pas g-yogs pas dmigs pa dang
translated: However, all these sentient beings are covered by the darkness of ignorance.

original: bcas par gyur ba'i rang bzhin des de ltar bur gzung bas 'khor bar bcings par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: bcas par gyur ba'i rang bzhin des de ltar bur gzung bas 'khor bar bcings par gyur pa yin no //
translated: By that nature, which is endowed with an object, they are bound in saṃsāra by such apprehension.

original: de nyid shes rab kyi @164b padmar lhan cig skyes pa'i ye shes de bzhin pa'i cho gas yang dag par rig pa las dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i lha rnams tshogs par nyams su myong bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid shes rab kyi @164b padmar lhan cig skyes pa'i ye shes de bzhin pa'i cho gas yang dag par rig pa las dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i lha rnams tshogs par nyams su myong bar bya ba ste /
translated: That very innate wisdom in the lotus of wisdom is the reality of suchness.

original: de nyid du de bzhin par dmigs pa med pa'i ye shes kyi mchog yang dag par rig pa las bcud kyis len la sogs pa thams cad du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nyid du de bzhin par dmigs pa med pa'i ye shes kyi mchog yang dag par rig pa las bcud kyis len la sogs pa thams cad du 'gyur te /
translated: In that very place, the supreme wisdom of non-apprehending suchness is the elixir of life, etc. for all, from the perfect knowledge.

original: dngos grub thams cad kyi gtso bo ni ye shes de nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos grub thams cad kyi gtso bo ni ye shes de nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that very wisdom is the chief of all powers.

original: de lta bu grub pa'i ye shes kyis gang byin gyis brlabs pa de nyid ni dngos grub kyi gnas su gyur pa yin gyi de las gzhan pa'i sngags dang sman la sogs pa'i sbyor ba de la mi ltos te de thams cad de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir
analyzed: de lta bu grub pa'i ye shes kyis gang byin gyis brlabs pa de nyid ni dngos grub kyi gnas su gyur pa yin gyi de las gzhan pa'i sngags dang sman la sogs pa'i sbyor ba de la mi ltos te de thams cad de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir
translated: Whatever is blessed by the wisdom of such accomplishment is itself the basis of power, and does not depend on other applications of mantra, medicine, etc. because all of those are of the nature of that.

original: ro zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: ro zhes dgongs so //
translated: This is the intended meaning.

original: sbyor ba gsang bar gnas pa'i rtsa //
analyzed: sbyor ba gsang bar gnas pa'i rtsa //
translated: The secret place of union is the channel.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ri mo can gyi sde'i da kho na nyid ji lta bu yin pa dris pa las ri mo can gyi sde'i rang bzhin ji ltar yin pa brjod pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ri mo can gyi sde'i da kho na nyid ji lta bu yin pa dris pa las ri mo can gyi sde'i rang bzhin ji ltar yin pa brjod pa ste /
translated: This and so forth is the question of the nature of the truth of the Lineages of the Array. The nature of the Lineages of the Array is stated as follows.

original: gsang bar gnas pa'i rtsa zhes bya ba ni rtsa de dag ni bde ba mchog gi rgyu des ri mo can nas mdzes ma zhes bya ba ste ngo mtshar ba'o //
analyzed: gsang bar gnas pa'i rtsa zhes bya ba ni rtsa de dag ni bde ba mchog gi rgyu des ri mo can nas mdzes ma zhes bya ba ste ngo mtshar ba'o //
translated: The so-called secret channel is the channel that is the cause of supreme bliss. It is called “the beautiful one” because it is the source of wonder.

original: bde ba'i rang bzhin gyi ye shes ni sde ma zhes bya bar brjod do //
analyzed: bde ba'i rang bzhin gyi ye shes ni sde ma zhes bya bar brjod do //
translated: The nature of bliss is called “the clan.”

original: de lta bu'i bde ba chen po'i ye shes kyi dngos po rtsa'i rgyu las yang dag par byung ba de ni ri mo can gyi sde zhes bya bar brjod do //🔽de nyid kyang theg pa chen po yin pa gsal bar mdzad pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: de lta bu'i bde ba chen po'i ye shes kyi dngos po rtsa'i rgyu las yang dag par byung ba de ni ri mo can gyi sde zhes bya bar brjod do // de nyid kyang theg pa chen po yin pa gsal bar mdzad pa gsungs pa /
translated: The entity of the gnosis of great bliss that arises from the cause of the channel is called “the clan of the beautiful one.”🔽It is also the Great Vehicle.

original: 'di de nyid ni theg pa chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di de nyid ni theg pa chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: This is stated in the line “This is the Great Vehicle,” and so forth.

original: 'byung gnas rtsa ni rnal 'byor ma //
analyzed: 'byung gnas rtsa ni rnal 'byor ma //
translated: The channel that is the source is the yoginī.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'byung gnas kyi rtsa gang dag dga' ba chen po'i ye shes su gnas pa ni ri mo can gyi rang bzhin te de nyid ni theg pa chen po zhes bya ba yin par brjod do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'byung gnas kyi rtsa gang dag dga' ba chen po'i ye shes su gnas pa ni ri mo can gyi rang bzhin te de nyid ni theg pa chen po zhes bya ba yin par brjod do //
translated: The channel that is the source of the gnosis of great bliss is the nature of the beautiful one. It is called “the Great Vehicle.”

original: de'i phyir na de nyid ni mchog gi ye shes te dngos grub kun gyi sgrub thabs yin no zhes gsal bar mdzad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir na de nyid ni mchog gi ye shes te dngos grub kun gyi sgrub thabs yin no zhes gsal bar mdzad do //
translated: Therefore, that is the supreme intuition, the means of achieving all powers.🔽This is the commentary on the first chapter of the King of Procedures Tan- tra, the Buddha Skull, the unexcelled yoga tantra, composed by the great

original: 'di dag ni rnal 'byor ba'i rgyud bla na med pa sangs rgyas thod pa zhes bya ba rgyud kyi rgyal po'i le'u dang po'i 'grel pa slob dpon mkhas pa chen po padma rdo rje zhes bya ba dngos grub chen po brnyes pas mdzad pa'o /
analyzed: 'di dag ni rnal 'byor ba'i rgyud bla na med pa sangs rgyas thod pa zhes bya ba rgyud kyi rgyal po'i le'u dang po'i 'grel pa slob dpon mkhas pa chen po padma rdo rje zhes bya ba dngos grub chen po brnyes pas mdzad pa'o /
translated: scholar-adept Padmarāja, who attained the great powers.

original: // / da ni sngags kyi dngos grub gsungs pa /
analyzed: // / da ni sngags kyi dngos grub gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the powers of mantra are taught:

original: de nas yang dag rab bshad pa //🔽zhes bya ba @165a * //
analyzed: de nas yang dag rab bshad pa // zhes bya ba @165a * //
translated: Then, the perfect explanation

original: la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: la sogs pa ste /
translated: is the mantra of the incense, etc.,🔽that accomplishes the yoginis.

original: rnal 'byor ma rnams grub par byed pa'i spos la sogs pa sbyin pa'i sngags de srid pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma rnams grub par byed pa'i spos la sogs pa sbyin pa'i sngags de srid pa gsungs pa /
translated: The mantra of the incense, etc., that accomplishes the yoginis is taught:

original: aom buddha ka p'a li ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: aom buddha ka p'a li ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Om Buddhakapalini!

original: aom h'am heem zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go cha'i sngags te /
analyzed: aom h'am heem zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go cha'i sngags te /
translated: Om ham heam! and so forth are the armor mantras.

original: snying ga dang / mchog ma dang / spyi gtsug dang / phrag pa dang / mig dag dang / yan lag thams cad la rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'di rnams kyis go cha bya'o //
analyzed: snying ga dang / mchog ma dang / spyi gtsug dang / phrag pa dang / mig dag dang / yan lag thams cad la rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'di rnams kyis go cha bya'o //
translated: One should thus arrange the armor in the heart, the throat, the head, the shoulders, the eyes, and all the limbs.🔽Oṃ buddhakapālinī akhaṃ.

original: aom buddha ka p'a li ni a'a kham zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnal 'byor ma ri mo can gyis sde spyan drangs pa'i ste /
analyzed: aom buddha ka p'a li ni a'a kham zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnal 'byor ma ri mo can gyis sde spyan drangs pa'i ste /
translated: Come, come, O goddess, come to this place, having come, be seated, and grant me the desired accomplishment.

original: yang dag par byon ni byin gyis rlob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag par byon ni byin gyis rlob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Having come, bless me.

original: de nas gtor ma dang mchod pa la sogs pa byas zin nas slar yang gshegs su gsol ba'i sngags gzhan dag gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nas gtor ma dang mchod pa la sogs pa byas zin nas slar yang gshegs su gsol ba'i sngags gzhan dag gsungs pa /
translated: Then, after having made the offerings of bali and worship, etc., one should again request the departure with other mantras.

original: aom ma h'a ka p'a la badzri ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: aom ma h'a ka p'a la badzri ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Oṃ mahākapāla vajrīṇi.🔽Having come, O goddess, having come, O goddess, depart, depart, O goddess.

original: de lta bu dag gis ni rnal 'byor ma dngos grub thams cad stsol par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bu dag gis ni rnal 'byor ma dngos grub thams cad stsol par 'gyur ro //
translated: By such [mantras], the yoginīs will grant all accomplishments.

original: de ni mi snang bar byed pa'i rab tu sbyor ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de ni mi snang bar byed pa'i rab tu sbyor ba gsungs te /
translated: Then, the application of invisibility is stated.

original: sbyor ba gang gis rnal 'byor pa lha dang lha ma yin dang mi rnams kyis kyang mi mthong ba'i rab tu sbyor ba de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: sbyor ba gang gis rnal 'byor pa lha dang lha ma yin dang mi rnams kyis kyang mi mthong ba'i rab tu sbyor ba de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: He states the very application by which the yogin is not seen even by gods, demigods, and humans.

original: 'bras dkar po blangs te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras dkar po blangs te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Taking white mustard seed, etc.

original: de la 'bras dkar po bu mo gzhon nu mas zhib mor btags pa byas las gzugs brnyan ni gzhon nu mas btags ma thag tu rang nyid kyis gzugs brnyan bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'bras dkar po bu mo gzhon nu mas zhib mor btags pa byas las gzugs brnyan ni gzhon nu mas btags ma thag tu rang nyid kyis gzugs brnyan bya'o //
translated: There, the white mustard seed is ground by a young girl, and the image is made by the girl herself immediately after grinding.

original: gzugs brnyan de yang gdong pa gcig pa lag pa bzhi pa bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan de yang gdong pa gcig pa lag pa bzhi pa bya'o //
translated: And that image should have one face and four arms.

original: de'i lag pa'i mtshon cha gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i lag pa'i mtshon cha gsungs pa /
translated: He states the weapons of her hands.

original: kha tv'am dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: kha tv'am dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The khatvanga, etc.

original: rdo rje las byung ba zhes bya ba mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje las byung ba zhes bya ba mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: The vajra is Akshobhya.

original: ji skad du gsungs pa de dag nyid cho ga bzhin du blangs te rnal 'byor bas brgya rtsa brgyad du sngags kyi bzlas pa bya'o //
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa de dag nyid cho ga bzhin du blangs te rnal 'byor bas brgya rtsa brgyad du sngags kyi bzlas pa bya'o //
translated: Having taken those very ones as stated, the yogin should do the mantra recitation one hundred and eight times according to the rite.

original: bzlas par bya ba'i sngags kyang sungs pa /
analyzed: bzlas par bya ba'i sngags kyang sungs pa /
translated: He states the mantra to be recited.🔽

original: aom ma h'a badzre zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: aom ma h'a badzre zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Oṃ mahāvajra, etc.

original: de nas chu la lan bdun yongs su bzlas nas gzugs brnyan la bsku'o //
analyzed: de nas chu la lan bdun yongs su bzlas nas gzugs brnyan la bsku'o //
translated: Then, having enchanted water seven times, one should sprinkle the reflection.

original: de'i lhag mas rang gi kha bskrus na mi mthong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i lhag mas rang gi kha bskrus na mi mthong bar 'gyur te /
translated: With the remainder of that, if one sprinkles one's own mouth, one will become invisible.

original: de nas de lta bus rnal 'byor ba sna tshogs su rol pa drung nyid na byed kyang gang gis kyang mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: de nas de lta bus rnal 'byor ba sna tshogs su rol pa drung nyid na byed kyang gang gis kyang mi mthong ngo //
translated: Then, by such means, even though one performs various enjoyments in the presence of the yogī, no one will see it.

original: de @165b nas 'o mas rang gi kha gdong bkrus na slar mthong bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de @165b nas 'o mas rang gi kha gdong bkrus na slar mthong bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, if one washes one's face with milk, one will again become visible.

original: mtshon cha rengs par bya ba'i rab tu sbyor ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: mtshon cha rengs par bya ba'i rab tu sbyor ba gsungs pa /
translated: The application for paralyzing weapons is stated:

original: gzugs brnyan de'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan de'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The reflection of that, etc.

original: ji skad du gsungs pa'i gzugs brnyan de'i snying gar ji skad bstan pa'i rab tu sbyor ba de dag bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa'i gzugs brnyan de'i snying gar ji skad bstan pa'i rab tu sbyor ba de dag bya ba ma yin te /
translated: One should not perform those applications as taught in the heart of that reflection as taught.

original: dur khrod kyi mes shing bang ga gtsor snying gar bcer te rab tu sbyar bar tshangs pa'i rdo rje ste /
analyzed: dur khrod kyi mes shing bang ga gtsor snying gar bcer te rab tu sbyar bar tshangs pa'i rdo rje ste /
translated: The Brahma-vajra is the stick of the Indian jujube tree, which is burned in the charnel ground fire, and is applied to the heart.

original: rnam par snang mdzad kyi gzugs brnyan yog par bskus nas bsregs pa'i thal ba blangs pa dang / rdo rje las byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsal lo //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad kyi gzugs brnyan yog par bskus nas bsregs pa'i thal ba blangs pa dang / rdo rje las byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsal lo //
translated: Having anointed an image of Vairocana with oil, and having burned it, one should take the ashes, and the “vajra-born” and so forth are clear.

original: de lta bu'i thal ba'i sbyor ba 'dis gdug pa can rnams rnam par 'jig par 'gyur ba yang blta'o //
